programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: A successful American football player, Clay Matthews, is in the process of building his dream home and wants a dream aquarium to match.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Dr Ross treats a rainforest mammal known as a kinkajou nearing its terrible twos. Dr Lavine is faced with a cat with a suspected contagious disease.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Dr. Ross and vet tech Kyrra rust to save the life of a stray cat injured by a car engine. And, Dr. Blue treats a 700lb pig who suffers from arthritis.

programme.title: Baby Pandas First Year
programme.desc: Following on from A Panda is Born this documentary tracks baby panda, Tai Shan, as he passes some important milestones to becoming an adult.

programme.title: Im Alive
programme.desc: Follow two incredible tales of survival and the determination to stay alive.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Jackson visits a "Cat-Bassador" who works with his guardian to help special needs cats find forever homes. Plus, Jackson visits an incredible prison programme.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Love is in the air at Australia Zoo! Terri helps determine if Caballe the Rhino is pregnant, while Robert matchmakes the zoos Aldabra giant tortoises.

programme.title: Dr. Dee: Alaska Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Dee flies to Healy, Alaska for a remote clinic. Plus, Dr. Dee prepares Nugget the Bull for breeding season and Dr. Terry gets a surprise giving shots to six kittens.

programme.title: My Tiny Terror
programme.desc: Diminutive doggies from the Greater Los Angeles area are visited by no-nonsense behavioural therapist Jacqueline Wilson, in a bid to correct their bad habits.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff performs surgery on Slash the dog who can’t keep his food down and weighs 20-lbs less than he should. Plus, Winter the cat has a bloody wound on his side.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Actor Tracy Morgan wants to swim with his huge sharks, so he wants the guys to tank his entire pool house!

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Dr Ross sees a Great Dane puppy with an umbilical hernia that requires treatment. Plus, the docs receive an invitation to a university gala as honourees.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: The docs head to a sanctuary for rescue cows to deal with a surprising baby boom by sterilising five bulls. Plus, 7-month old pup Skittles faces surgery.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: A pygmy goat comes into the clinic for an abscess. Dr. Lavigne is kept busy with a protection dog that doesnt like the cameras and the Blues throw a gender reveal party.

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Inman and Eddins assist on a manhunt when a suspect runs a constable off the road in southeast Texas. Meanwhile, a landlord complains about trespassers.

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Pete builds an all-star speakeasy for basketball legend Shaquille ONeal. He creates a decagonal structure with soaring ceilings and extra-wide stairs.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: At an Alabama shelter, Tia and Earl face a tough decision on an elderly hound. Plus, an aggressive dog is found roaming a trash-filled backyard.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Jackson makes his way to Brooklyn, where a couple are seeing their relationship suffer over the ongoing blood feud between their two cats.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Wayde and Brett make a tank for world famous artist and DJ Redfoo of the band LMFAO. The guys attempt their very first one of a kind DJ booth aquarium. Will this tank be able to get the party started?

programme.title: Alaska: Surviving the Last Frontier
programme.desc: Four groups of intrepid adventurers abandon the convenience and technological trappings of modern living and attempt to survive the wilds of Alaska.

programme.title: Flying Wild Alaska
programme.desc: In Bethel, construction crews race to finish Eras newest hangar before the winter snow comes. But when impatient Jim flies in to inspect the progress will he be happy?

programme.title: In Search Of Monsters
programme.desc: New evidence reveals a Vietnam War pilot may have returned home with a secret cargo. Experts use this to try and find the missing link in human evolution.

programme.title: Wild Mexico
programme.desc: Mexico. It is an ancient, majestic land, full of diversity and mystery. It is home to a vast wilderness of oceans, deserts, jungle, and unique creatures that are found nowhere else on earth.

programme.title: Im Alive
programme.desc: When a hunter is brutally attacked by three grizzly bears, his best friend must find a way to get him to help before its too late.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Dr Ross takes care of a pair of roosters involved in a barnyard brawl and joins Dr Lavigne for a hyena consultation. And, Dr Blue treats a paralysed Yorkie.

programme.title: The Vet Life
programme.desc: Dr Blue needs to act fast when a Rottweiler in labor is rushed to the hospital. And, the three vets put on their cowboy boots for Houstons biggest rodeo parade.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: The behaviour of Sebastian, a violent cat, puts a newborn baby in jeopardy. Plus, a door opening wild cat, Zeus, is threatening to leave his owner.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: Lizzy tries to track down the owner of a dog tied up outside the rescue centre. Plus, an older couple come looking for their first dog.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: Two strays lead Lizzy and Villalobos staff on a wild goose chase. A grandmother comes in looking for another canine companion, but her dog Daisy has other plans.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: Lizzy and Elise struggle to rescue a stray dog found on the train tracks. Plus, a woman falls in love with a Labrador, but her current dog isnt so welcoming.

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: In Chambers County, Dockery responds to a call about an alligator stuck in a residential area. Plus, the Wardens find blood in the boot of a suspicious hunters car.

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: In Van Zandt County, Herchman discovers a woman sleeping in her car who may be under the influence of drugs. Plus, a man is found with several outstanding warrants.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Jeff heads to Texas to help out rescued animals after Hurricane Harvey. Back in Denver, a woman brings in Bear who needs surgery after eating a sock.

programme.title: Dr. Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff fights to save a pit bull bitten by a rattlesnake; the team battles to save a cherished cat rescued from an apartment fire.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Theres huge excitement at Australia Zoo: Rosie the Giraffe is set to give birth! Robert has a bloody encounter with a wild python that entered an enclosure.

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: While Bindi and the keepers ready Sophie the baby Giraffe for her first steps into her enclosure, Robert helps to raise another baby: Melman the Kangaroo.

programme.title: Jeremy Wades Dark Waters
programme.desc: Tasmania is home to species found nowhere else on earth, including a colossal freshwater beast capable of breaking a persons arm. Jeremy Wade ventures into the islands dense, eerie forests in search of this formidable creature.

programme.title: Pit Bulls And Parolees
programme.desc: Tia races to rescue four dogs from a rural shelter in Louisiana from euthanasia. Plus, Mariah and Toney give a scared, shy dog a shot at a forever home.

programme.title: My Cat From Hell
programme.desc: Jackson visits New York City to meet a father and son whove been taking care of a feral cat colony in their backyard and are desperately in need of help.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Latin music star Prince Royce spices up his Miami mansion with a custom aquarium by ATM. Wayde and Brett strive to make this tank as royal as possible.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Seven foot tall NBA Star Hassan Whiteside knows a thing or two about what it means to be BIG. He tasks Wayde and Brett with building him a tank SO BIG it wont fit through the front door and has to be delivered to his Miami pad on a barge!

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: What are lions saying when they roar? Plus, what are leaf cutter ants doing with all the leaves they collect? Experts answer these questions and more!

programme.title: How Do Animals Do That?
programme.desc: Why do domestic cats find it so hard to get down from trees, and how have two jungle cats evolved? Plus, why do kiwi birds lay monster-sized eggs compared to their size?

programme.title: Pet Nation Renovation#OneOff
programme.desc: From conception to completion, this renovation team goes above and beyond to improve the lives of hundreds of animals by renovating shelters in desperate need.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: MMA fighter Urijah Faber just opened his new gym and wants a bit of the ocean inside. And a couple wants a tank for the Marine Aquarium Convention.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: A previous customer is back, asking for an even bigger and better tank. And, the guys build a custom acrylic waterfall for a memorial in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Expedition Bigfoot
programme.desc: The team believes theyve finally narrowed down where Bigfoot has been hiding throughout their expedition. A high-tech drone is brought in to investigate.

programme.title: Jungle Shark
programme.desc: Dr. Craig OConnell and Andy Casagrande travel up the Serena River to try and find out why young bull sharks swim up the river, and how they avoid the crocodiles living there.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: An endangered Chinese alligator shows signs of being pregnant. And, staff prepare to release rare New England cottontail rabbits into the wild.

programme.title: Meet The Penguins
programme.desc: Amputee Cedrics happy marriage to wife Robin faces its biggest challenge, Squeaker the juvenile tests peoples patience and a wild penguin comes in with a life-threatening wound.

programme.title: Dodo Heroes
programme.desc: 7-year-old social media sensation Roman McConn and his mum have saved over 1,500 shelter dogs by connecting them with adopters around the USA.

programme.title: How Sharks Hunt
programme.desc: Examine the hunting approaches of tiger sharks and great whites, namely the polaris breach, aerial breach and surface broach. What makes these killer strategies so effective?

programme.title: Pet Nation Renovation#OneOff
programme.desc: From conception to completion, this renovation team goes above and beyond to improve the lives of hundreds of animals by renovating shelters in desperate need.

programme.title: Les super-predateurs des mers
programme.desc: Une plongee dans les secrets de l’intelligence animale, à la decouverte des incroyables strategies de chasse deployees par les predateurs marins. Tourne en Argentine, dans la baie de Puerto Madryn, cet episode decrypte la technique d’echouage des orques, et revèle avec des images aeriennes comment, au sein du clan, elle se transmet aux jeunes, futurs chasseurs.

programme.title: Les super-predateurs des mers
programme.desc: Les effets du changement climatique mettent en presence des espèces qui ne se sont jamais rencontrees auparavant.

programme.title: Des animaux et des arbres
programme.desc: Traversee dimages spectaculaires, cette immersion dans la foret gaspesienne, au Canada, revèle les liens etonnants quentretiennent les arbres et les animaux.

programme.title: Les animaux de l’aeroport
programme.desc: Lapins, renards, campagnols, herissons, chevreuils, etourneaux, rapaces... : les aeroports abritent une biodiversite insoupçonnee. À travers les yeux d’un renard aventureux, une malicieuse exploration de la faune qui peuple les abords des aeroports.

programme.title: Depression chez les hommes, un mal silencieux
programme.desc: À la rencontre de patients et de specialistes, cet etat des lieux sensible revèle combien il reste difficile pour une majorite dhommes souffrant de depression den reconnaître les symptômes.

programme.title: ARTE Regards
programme.desc: En Roumanie, la stigmatisation des troubles psychiques reste profonde, et ceux qui en souffrent trop souvent relegues en marge de la societe. Ciprian Hord, psychologue et photographe, travaille dans un hôpital. Arme de son appareil photo, de son empathie et de sa creativite, il capture des fragments d’humanite, des eclats de dignite retrouvee et offre aux malades un nouvel espace d’expression.

programme.title: ARTE Journal Junior du vendredi
programme.desc: Imaginez que votre emploi du temps comprenne, outre les mathematiques et lallemand, le pilotage de drones ? Cest le cas à lecole militaire de Legnica en Pologne. Les elèves y apprennent de manière ludique à manier ces appareils volants. Mais ce programme nest bien sûr pas là juste pour le plaisir : la Pologne se prepare ainsi à utiliser des drones en cas de guerre. Nous vous expliquons comment.

programme.title: GEO Reportage
programme.desc: En Estonie, larrivee de lete marque le debut de la saison des mariages. Pour sassurer un moment inoubliable, les amoureux ne laissent rien au hasard et ne lesinent pas sur les jeux de plein air. Chaque ete, des dizaines de candidates viennent de toute lEstonie et des pays voisins pour participer à une course de jeunes mariees sous les encouragements de leur moitie, dans lespoir de decrocher une belle recompense.

programme.title: Voyage en cuisine
programme.desc: "Voyage en cuisine" nous emmène dans les cuisines du monde entier, à la decouverte de recettes traditionnelles et de leurs origines. Le roi des poissons australiens : le barramundi - Le goût du pays : Daniel, un Australien à Athènes.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: Linda Lorin nous emmène à la decouverte de notre patrimoine artistique, culturel et naturel. Au Costa Rica, Walter Ferguson sacre roi du calypso - En Irak, Gertrude Bell dessine un pays - En Allemagne, le ragoût de poumon de veau de Susanne - À Cerbère, les oranges ont le goût de la revolte.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: Linda Lorin nous emmène à la decouverte de notre patrimoine artistique, culturel et naturel. La psychose new-yorkaise de Bret Easton Ellis - Au Benin, la Route de l’esclave - À Tourcoing, la fricadelle au maroilles de Corentin et Laurence - En Slovenie, resister par la voix.

programme.title: Une histoire mondiale de la navigation
programme.desc: Depuis quand les humains sillonnent-ils les mers ? Une retrospective de l’histoire de la navigation, de l’Antiquite jusqu’à la mise à leau des premiers paquebots, illustree par dimpressionnantes archives.

programme.title: 360° Reportage
programme.desc: GEO Reportage parcourt le monde à la recherche d’histoires extraordinaires et de rencontres insolites.

programme.title: Le ventre de Cracovie
programme.desc: À Cracovie, le marche Stary Kleparz offre une grande variete de produits indispensables aux recettes typiques de la cuisine polonaise, tels que le bigos, un ragoût de chou fermente, les ravioles ou pierogi, l’oscypek, un fromage fume, ou encore les paczki, des beignets fourres à la confiture.

programme.title: Les maîtres des abeilles
programme.desc: L’abeille carniolienne est originaire de Slovenie. Les habitants de ce petit pays des Balkans nourrissent un profond respect pour cette espèce autochtone. Brane Kozinc, issu d’une longue lignee d’apiculteurs, est l’un des quinze eleveurs officiels du pays. Il a installe ses ruches sur les pentes du Triglav, le plus haut sommet slovène, situe dans les Alpes juliennes.

programme.title: ARTE Regards
programme.desc: Servals, sangliers, singes : de plus en plus de particuliers s’entourent d’animaux de compagnie inhabituels. Un phenomène qui conduit trop souvent à des conditions de vie inadaptees. Dans ce reportage, des passionnees s’engagent pour offrir un foyer à ces animaux sauvages. Un combat freine par le manque de moyens et les obstacles juridiques.

programme.title: Lappât
programme.desc: Après avoir capture un hors-la-loi, trois hommes s’associent dans un voyage seme d’embûches pour empocher la prime.

programme.title: Le Massif central
programme.desc: Avec ses plateaux de calcaire blanc tranchant sur des forets verdoyantes, le Massif central est une terre de contrastes dont les habitants luttent pour preserver la beaute. Des cratères des volcans auvergnats aux eaux cristallines de l’Allier, ultime fleuve sauvage de France, premier volet d’une exploration pleine de surprises.

programme.title: Le Massif central
programme.desc: Le Massif central est une terre de contrastes dont les habitants luttent pour preserver la beaute. Second chapitre du voyage avec un portrait des Cevennes et de l’Ardèche, à travers plusieurs initiatives locales pensees pour proteger les specificites du territoire et garantir un artisanat durable.

programme.title: Le ventre de Bucarest
programme.desc: Deambulations gourmandes dans de celèbres marches du Vieux Continent, où se melent couleurs, parfums, produits de saison et echanges animes.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: Quatre sujets pour decouvrir la Jamaïque : l’ecrivain americain Russel Banks et son polar, "Le livre de la Jamaïque" ; le rastafarisme ; la recette du pudding de patates douces ; Saint Ann’s Bay, le lieu où echoua la flotte de Christophe Colomb en 1503.

programme.title: Invitation au voyage
programme.desc: Linda Lorin nous emmène à la decouverte de notre patrimoine artistique, culturel et naturel. Gabrielle Filteau-Chiba, l’encabanee du Quebec - El Yunque, la foret enchantee de Porto Rico - En Nouvelle-Zelande, le poisson au curry de Shaan - Les momies font frissonner le Mexique.

programme.title: Voyage gourmand
programme.desc: C’est dans les montagnes du nord-est de la Sardaigne que Renzo et Franca Corda elèvent leurs abeilles, productrices de miel de thym et de romarin sauvage. Sur l’île de La Gomera, Guarapero Tanausú Chavez recolte le precieux miel de palme, sève du palmier dattier, symbole des Canaries. En glace cremeuse ou en pain d’epice pour agrementer son filet de chevreuil, la cheffe Lucie Fischer-Chapalain explore les declinaisons de l’or liquide.

programme.title: Le dessous des cartes
programme.desc: "Le dessous des cartes" se penche sur un drame qui se joue en silence sous nos yeux : l’extinction d’innombrables espèces d’animaux. Des pans entiers de la faune disparaissent à un rythme sans precedent sur tous les continents. Quels sont les grands foyers de disparition ? Que revèle la carte mondiale des espèces menacees ? Et que pouvons-nous encore sauver ?

programme.title: ARTE Journal
programme.desc: Chaque jour à 19h45, la redaction franco-allemande dARTE Journal propose une approche europeenne et culturelle de lactualite. Un regard original sur le monde.

programme.title: 28 minutes
programme.desc: Presente par Élisabeth Quin du lundi au jeudi et Renaud Dely les vendredi et samedi, le rendez-vous quotidien consacre à l’actualite et au debat.

programme.title: Tu mourras moins bete
programme.desc: Le professeur Moustache demystifie la science par la pratique. Une serie danimation "scientifico-trash" à lhumour ravageur, avec la voix de François Morel. Aujourdhui : peut-on confondre de la pâtee pour chien avec des rillettes ? Si vous etes un chien, non, si vous etes un homme, oui.

programme.title: Meurtres à Sandhamn
programme.desc: Des decès suspects commencent à etre signales à la police, causes par ce qui semble etre un nouveau narcotique chimique. La police interrompt une vente de stupefiants et un jeune trafiquant est arrete. Nora est appele sur laffaire et rencontre pour la première fois Alexander, un nouvel enqueteur...

programme.title: Bruce Springsteen, le chanteur qui murmurait à loreille de lAmerique
programme.desc: Retour sur la carrière du "Boss", icône sensible et revoltee dont la guitare a accompagne les combats brûlants de son siècle – et qui a presente au monde le meilleur visage de lAmerique.

programme.title: Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band - Darkness on the Edge of Town
programme.desc: En 2009, Bruce Springsteen et son E Street Band sinstallaient dans un theâtre historique du New Jersey pour celebrer les trente ans de lalbum "Darkness on The Edge of Town". Dans une performance rare et inedite à la television, lartiste et ses musiciens reprenaient la plupart des titres de cet opus legendaire.

programme.title: Le choix nous appartient
programme.desc: L’enlèvement du penseur allemand Jan Philipp Reemtsma en 1996 marque un tournant majeur dans la vie de son fils, le futur musicien Johann Scheerer. Inspiree du roman autobiographique dans lequel celui-ci raconte la prise d’otage de son père, cette fiction haletante brosse un portrait sensible de l’adolescence.

The blue nerds get ejected hard by venue security, and Lamput becomes the hit look of the show. So versatile! So changeable! One size fits all!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean buys an expensive dress for Irma which he plans to return - so has to protect it from damage.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is feeling very left out when he discovers that Mrs Wicket is having a huge party downstairs and apparently he isn’t invited. Bean tries every trick in the book to sneak himself into the party – even resorting to hiding inside an enormous cake. If only he knew the real reason for the celebration.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean digs a hole in his garden - and finds a bomb!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: After (accidentally) rescuing a kitten from a tree Mr. Bean is set to have his picture in the newspaper!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings discover that oysters can make pearls and play marbles with it which is driving Grizzy crazy.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Jealous, Grizzy tries to switch his indifferent fish with the Lemmings affectionate and lively fish

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings use all the cans and tins they can get their hands on to build a beach slide which annoys Grizzy.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings decide to shelter a crab from a seagull but soon, Grizzy sees it as a threat to his peaceful day.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings play pirates on a beached boat. Grizzy, who is fishing further down, realizes that with the Lemmings’ boat, he could come closer to a zone that’s teeming with fish. Grizzy takes a malicious pleasure playing pirate himself to unseat the Lemmings and steal their boat. The Lemmings discover a chest containing real pirate belongings. A telescope conjures the owner’s ghost who immediately places his saber and hook at their disposal.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy sets sail with his fishing gear. But he has no intention of fishing: its a scheme to enjoy a jar of Yummy chocolate spread alone in peace. The Lemmings sense the subterfuge and sink his boat to get the treat, which sinks to the ocean depths. The characters dive in pursuit and discover a school of intelligent crabs that live in an underwater city. Their treasure is a substance that’s even yummier than Yummy.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings find the cabin upside down. Upon closer inspection, it looks like an epic battle took place there. And Grizzy isnt here. The curious Lemmings start imagining what could have happened, visualizing the most improbable scenes for us. They decide to follow their lead to find Grizzy and confirm their zany theories.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After refusing to practice with her new underwater mode, Batwing is unable to save Batman from Penguins sunken ship trap.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After agreeing to swap motherboards and change bodies, the Batwheels have to quickly learn to “drive a mile in each other’s wheels” in time to stop the approaching Legion of Zoom!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bibi has some competition with Nightwing’s motorcycle, Nightbike. These stunt bikes will need to learn that they’re better when they work together.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Ducky and Quizz steal the Bat-Signal’s one-of-a-kind lightbulb, Bam and Batwing must find a way to restore the legendary light.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Mayor Foghorn Leghorn hires The Looney Builders to build a giant water slide for Looneyburg’s waterpark.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders race against the clock to build Cecil Turtle a new racetrack.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Wanting to cool off from the blistering heat, Tom and Jerry use a little magic to make it snow, turning the witches world into a haunted winter wonderland with an evil snowman, haunted snow forts and magic snowball fights. Now they have to figure out how to make it stop snowing.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: An overflowing trash bin filled with crumpled paper can mean only one thing…Tom is writing a novel - its a mystery novel, of course! Tom soon realizes his book is playing out in real life (including the femme fatale who has taken an interest in the feline Mikey Spillane). At first, Tom has fun crafting his own fate, but soon realizes no matter how hard he tries to rewrite his story, he gets deeper and deeper into trouble. Jerry begins to suspect the alley cat, Butch, is up to no good – in the end, Jerry figures out Butch was retrieving Toms discarded writing from the trash and using it to his advantage!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Ginger brings home a new pet—a mynah bird who can mimic anyone and anything. Rick complains about the money they will have to spend to feed and care for another pet. Spike and Tom are on notice, as somebodys got to go.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Its that special time of year when the Lady of the Houses rare, exotic (and very stinky) cheese gets delivered to the manor. Its up to Tom to make sure not a crumb of this cheese—known to be a favorite of mice—goes missing.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Ginger decides she wants to teach Tom to walk on a leash to ensure he gets much-needed exercise. Tom hates the leash and does not want to go for a walk. Finally, theyre on their way, much to Toms chagrin. Back home, Jerry and Tuffy proceed to raid the fridge.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Ginger leaves some frozen fish on the kitchen counter to thaw. Ginger and Rick warn Tom to keep his paws away, or he will not get anything to eat. Soon, a live baby octopus crawls out of the mouth of one of the thawing fish and jumps off the counter, looking for a place to hide. Jerry befriends him and does his best to protect him from Tom.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Its Priyas birthday, so the gang is looking for something special as a gift for her. Ella suggests a birthday star, which is a star that is the same light years away as your age.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella stretches the truth a bit when she tells Angelie she can comet surf. She decides to try but finds its a lot harder than it looks. Slippy adds rockets to an asteroid so Ella can practice on that instead.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Slippy needs iron to fix his spaceracer. Ella tows him to a metal asteroid where Glitch is instructed to cut off a small piece. But when Ella distracts him, he accidentally cuts the asteroid into two large pieces! Ella feels responsible

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella is excited to get her own room but Tilly is not as thrilled. She asks Slippy if he can make her a time machine to slow down time so tomorrow never comes. Slippy says the only place time shows down is around black holes.

programme.desc: Ella has her best idea yet for a fun day. They will visit a nebula for each member of the family! Up first is Bernard 68, but it is very dark and frightens Tilly. When Dads truck breaks down, they head to the Boomerang nebula.

programme.desc: The Lemmings’ hard rock concert is driving Grizzy mad. After kicking them out, Grizzy requisitions their ghetto blaster and listens to a relaxation cassette to calm down. programme.desc: Mr Bean buys a robot to clean his flat but it ends up trashing half the town.

programme.desc: An AI accidentally connects to Grizzy’s stuffed teddy bear, which comes to life.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: When the Lemmings spoil Grizzys meal with their new game, the bear evicts them far from the cabin. They crash onto a faraway picnic table.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Jerry helps a Leprechaun retrieve the pot of gold that hes lost to Tom.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: A bouquet of flowers causes Tom no end of trouble.

programme.desc: Tuffy surprises Jerry with a visit from the actor who plays his favorite TV show character The Masked Mouse.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Pretending to be butterflies, Tuffy And Jerry cause all sorts of trouble in the house, until the Duke catches Tuffy with the intention of adding him to his butterfly collection.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: The Mice from Mars make a return visit and set about making mischief between Spike and Tom.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean buys an expensive dress for Irma which he plans to return - so has to protect it from damage.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean has got everything ready for Irma’s birthday; card cake candles but he just needs to get her some flowers. But nothing goes to plan as Mr Bean inadvertently causes a car crash involving a bride on her wedding day. There’s no time to lose as Mr Bean promises he’ll get the bride to the church on time. Irma is not a happy lady as Mr Bean is distracted by the task in hand.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is keen to own a brand new smart phone when he discovers all the wonderful things it can do. But after a trip to the mobile phone shop he is horrified at how much they cost and decides to build his own one. Bean’s phone may be bulky but it comes with a whole range of built in gadgets especially useful during a race to The Tower of London.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: A clueless yet clever loner bungles his way through life in London. Mr Bean has some unexpected guests who think he runs a hotel!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean cannot, for the life of him, place the face of the uninvited fat bloke on his doorstep. An old school photograph and school cap just about jog his memory. By this time his new ‘friend’ has put his feet up and is eating Bean out of house and home. This blast from the past proves to be a blasted pain in the neck.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Irma Gobb watches TV with Mr Bean but his set explodes during an argument, leaving the hapless halfwit to invent his own form of home entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs Wicket has just inherited an antique grandfather clock – Mr Bean is impressed! But he soon starts to resent it when it bongs loudly on the hour all through the night. Desperate for sleep as dawn is breaking, he fiddles inside the clock, only for it to fall apart and onto the floor! Can he get the bulky heirloom to a repair shop and back before Mrs Wicket wakes up?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: While Mr. Bean is taking photos of wildlife, he sees big footprints belonging to a dinosaur. He starts running away but then gets an idea to take a photo of these footprints, hoping hell become famous. However, the dinosaur turns out to be part of a set for a movie called Jurassic Hero and Bean is added to the cast.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean accidently causes Mrs Wicket to be hospitalised and in need of a wheelchair. Back home Mr Bean has thoughtfully set up a bell service so that he can be at Mrs Wicket’s beck and call at any time of day or night. Mrs Wicket likes this...a lot. The bell doesn’t stop ringing and an exhausted Mr Bean finds himself running up and down the stairs carrying and fetching until he eventually loses patience with his patient.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean ends up on stage at the opera house...in a dress!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput is stuck in the lab with a dangerous robot on the loose! Its up to the entire Lab team to save him before it is too late.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Specs and the jewel thief have a lot in common. They are both round and blue. Also they both like accelerating into blind corners. A full-speed collision results in an accidental identity mixup - suddenly the thief finds himself with a real job at the Lab, and poor old Specs is being used as bedding by a hulking prison inmate. When Lamput decides to open up a can of kick-butt, the thief starts to wonder if a life of crime might be safer after all. Specs has no doubt at all where hed prefer to be. Lamput unveils a surprising skill at the kung-fu nerve-pinch. Specs is busted out of the clink, and returns to the life he loves: sprinting alongside his best bud Skinny, constantly failing to catch ol Lamput.

programme.title: Krypto Saves the Day!
programme.desc: Krypto embarks on a high-flying chase that creates major mayhem for a bus driver on his way to school.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Chef Hector hires The Looney Builders to build him a burger restaurant, but Daffy is so focused on beating his handheld game.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders: Hard Hat Time
programme.desc: Bugs tries to play music for the crew on their lunch break, but his “boogie button” is busted.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bam brings Catwomans Catmobile, Kitty, to life so the Batwheels can have even teams for their game of "Bat-Ball," but the Kitty "Kitty" is too wild to be contained, despite Bams best attempts to convince her to play along.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Everyone assumes that Harley Quinn is the culprit in a recent burglary. But as Batman and Bam pursue Harley, Bibi and Redbird begin to suspect that she may actually be innocent.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang travels to Britain in 1843-ish and runs into Scrooge who claims he was attacked by the ghost of his partner Jacob Marley and that three more ghosts are coming. The gang agrees to solve the mystery but Velma wonders if she has more potential than just solving mysteries.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: A very bad parking choice on Freds part leads the gang to an asteroid mining base in outer space where an alien virus appears to be infecting the crew one by one, turning them into evil skull-headed aliens. The paranoid, terrified gang must try to solve the mystery before the virus reaches them, as well – if it hasnt already!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is at the supermarket when he spots a cool fire engine ride – but the security guard makes it clear it’s for little kids only. Not to be deterred, Mr Bean tries everything he can to distract the guard to have his go on the ride. When he finally does get his go, it’s not as good as he thought it would be, especially when a real fire engine has to be called to help Mr Bean!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean tries to watch TV with Teddy, but as he tries to find the remote, lots of springs come out of his sofa, prompting him to buy a new sofa. Since he cannot afford a new sofa costing £300, Bean decides to have a yard sale. Eventually, he sells a stamp for £300 to a passerby and then buys the sofa. However, Bean soon realises that his TV remote is still inside the old sofa.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless halfwit finds a treasure map in a dusty corner of his attic, but the road to riches proves a rocky one.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is furious with the untidy state of the streets and all the people who drop litter so he goes on a one-man mission to clean up the town. Armed with several bin bags Mr Bean collects all the rubbish and puts up his own ‘No Littering’ signs - which have absolutely no effect. When the police show no interest in his campaign Bean builds a homemade vacuuming contraption causing chaos and mayhem wherever he goes.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings lay hands on an ancient console, and Grizzy is transported into the game.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy has anticipated everything for his birthday and plans on spending a peaceful day in the cabin doing his favorite activities. programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings find a magic stick that functions as a Yummy divining rod. Grizzy steals their stick and finds a Yummy deposit in the savanna. To take control over Grizzy’s discovery, the Lemmings set a trap to draw the bear far from the deposit and transform it into an industrial chocolate factory. Grizzy will want to recover his chocolate deposit.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: An eclipse prevents the solar panels from supplying the cabin with electricity and Grizzy is disgruntledbecause he can’t watch TV. When he discovers that the Lemmings are using fireflies to have a party withoutelectricity, Grizzy evicts the Lemmings and recovers the fireflies to fuel the solar panels. The Lemmingshappen upon a jewel that gives them total control over the fireflies.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings recover a jar of Yummy from an automatic distributor but before they can enjoy it Grizzy confiscates the treat. In exchange, he leaves them the keyring that came as a gift. The Lemmings aren’t interested until the keyring lands in a magic vial which gives it an extraordinary power: stick the keyring onto any object and it will shrink to the size of a plastic miniature figurine!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Nutty Hill is suffering from a stifling heat wave. Grizzy decides to get into the fridge, where the temperature will be more bearable, but the shelves are already full of Lemmings.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang’s trip to be bayou is ruined by a shambling Swamp Beast that’s scaring away anyone who dares to enter it’s soggy domain!

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang hits the ski slopes, but the fun is soon interrupted by the appearance of an evil Snowman Monster eager to scare all trespassers off his mountain.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Specs and Skinny spruce themselves up and head out to a piano concerto in the royal concert hall. Theyre on their best behavior, until they spot a fellow culture vulture who also happens to be small, orange and squishy. Honestly, theyre letting all sorts of rabble into these places these days. The Docs decide that a sleeping potion might be a quick and quiet way of capturing Lamput. Naturally things get out of hand, and when the entire audience catches a whiff of the snoozy brew, we find out exactly how hard it is to stay awake during a classical music recital. One star.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is at the supermarket when he spots a cool fire engine ride – but the security guard makes it clear it’s for little kids only. Not to be deterred, Mr Bean tries everything he can to distract the guard to have his go on the ride. When he finally does get his go, it’s not as good as he thought it would be, especially when a real fire engine has to be called to help Mr Bean!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean accidentally swaps trunks with a magician with magical results!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean doesn’t like sharing the local soft play centre with a load of rowdy kids – so he goes home and builds his own house of fun.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: As Mr Bean settles down to watch his favourite TV programme he hears loud noises from next-door. He moves from house to garden but can’t escape the relentless cacophony of trumpets, electric drills, and screaming babies. Bean’s mind turns to thoughts of revenge….

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy dreams of drinking some nice cold coconut milk on the couch. Step one, get rid of the Lemmings who are having fun flying through the living room. Two, find coconuts that havent been emptied of their nectar. While Grizzy struggles to pick coconuts that are too high up, the Lemmings find a magic conch. By simply dusting yourself with its sand, you can fly! It doesnt take Grizzy long to figure this out and the bear rapidly imagines himself as Peter Pan sipping on his easily-harvested coconut milk.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy wants to watch TV in peace. The Lemmings have other plans: they want to have fun playing music with homemade instruments. Exasperated by the racket theyre making in the garage, Grizzy destroys the instruments and sends the Lemmings flying. The Lemmings discover a magic ukulele that bewitches anyone who hears its music: the perfect tool to regain control of the cabin and get back to their concert.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy cant sleep because its too hot. He decides to confiscate the fans the Lemmings use to power their fake spaceship. Totally into their Space Opera game, the Lemmings try to repel the alien Grizzy with "laser" party favors and are propelled onto an "unknown planet": a volcano crater with a secret base where a rocket is ready to take off. The rocket carries the cabin into space. Its no longer a game: Grizzy and the Lemmings will have to face the dangers of outer space!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy uses insecticide and a fly swatter to get rid of vermin that are bothering him during his siesta. The Lemmings heal his last victim: a cute little insect they adopt as their house pet. Only problem, their starving mascot only eats wood! The cabin has lots of it, but when Grizzy realizes that an insect is eating his home from the inside, he takes drastic measures to eliminate it permanently.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy asks the Lemmings to play with a baby ostrich found outside in exchange for their ventilator.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy has played for too many hours on the console. His eyes are so fatigued he cannot stand a single ray of light. The Lemmings choose this very moment to throw a big birthday party with as many lights as possible! Grizzy goes to great lengths to settle the issue and decides to trip the power supply. The Lemmings discover a source of magical light deep in the savanna.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings decide to play hide-and-seek in the Savannah.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Kitty is staying over at the Batcave for a sleepover, but getting her to lie down for a catnap is no easy task as the Batwheels have to find creative ways to get her to sleep.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Redbird learns a lesson in asking for permission when he takes one of Buffs stuffed animals without asking.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Bam is covered in super bouncy Bounce X goo during a chase with Prank, he must learn to use his newfound bouncing abilities to his advantage.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Bam must learn to adapt and try something new as he’s tasked to dive the Bat Big Rig all the way to Star City, while the Legion of Zoom chases after him.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: George P. Mandrake hires The Looney Builders to build a T. Rex fossil.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Pauleen Penguin hires The Looney Builders to build her a home in Looneyburg. Lola soon discovers they got the design wrong and the crew has to make adjustments.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Tweety leads the Looney Builders in building a new merry-go-round at the park for the kids. When his crane breaks down, his small size affects his ability to contribute to the build.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders learn that Taz accidentally destroyed his house, so they set out to build him a new one thats smash-proof.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Up to their usual antics, Tom, Jerry and Spike get into monkey business with a drone at Rick and Gingers house.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Its time for the annual croquet tournament at the Manor. The butler tells Tom how important it is to the Lady of the Manor to always win…no matter what! The last thing they need is any pesky rodents interfering with the game. Knowing any sighting of Jerry or Tuffy would cast Tom in a bad light, hes determined to keep them off the lawn.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: The Lady of the Manors prize Pomeranian, Alfred, must get some pounds off before the big dog show. The butler suggests exercise—chasing a cat perhaps? Tom happily obliges, as Alfreds successful weight loss guarantees him a cushy spot upstairs. Meanwhile, Jerry aims to sabotage Toms efforts.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: When Rick and Ginger go to a couples retreat, they leave Tom with Ricks Auntie Louella. Hearing that shes a whiz in the kitchen, Jerry comes along. The old woman is sweet, but she has a nasty little lap dog that bedevils Tom like crazy. Louella keeps treating Tom poorly, and Tom and Jerry make their plans to escape.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: The Lady of the Houses cousins, the Van der Snoots, visit with their prize-winning Persian cat, Prancy Van der Snoot. Tom is warned to make sure that Snooty doesnt catch sight of the pesky manor mice, lest she get upset or dirty her snowy white paws chasing the vermin. Tom is on it, but nothing goes as planned...

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom is watching a hypnotist on TV, when the words "you are asleep" hit him hard. He becomes a virtual rag doll and ends up in a jumble of junk for Rick and Gingers yard sale. A woman who thinks hes a stuffed animal buys him. Jerry feels bad and hops aboard the car to rescue Tom.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: The gang is practicing to play Saturn Dance with Priya when she calls to tell them she is sick. She wont be able to come. Ella is very disappointed and wonders how they can cheer up Priya.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: When Slippy, Madhu and Ella head out to see a SuperNova, they arrive too late because of Slippys endless preparations. The gang quickly decide to go zip-lining on Ganymede instead.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella and Slippy are practicing Pluto Jump Ride when Tilly begs to go too. Ella tells her its too dangerous and gives her a practice jump stick before she leaves. Madhu arrives to play and finds Tilly alone.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella, Slippy and Madhu are spiral space diving when Ella explains what inspired the idea. Its a huge colourful spiral that Maggie is not able to identify. As she tries, she begins to glitch.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: The Ryder family completes a drill in the event of a Starquake. Shields are deployed around Home and Dads museum on the moon. The drill is a success but the shield on the moon is stuck open.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Adder convinces Toad that her marvellous mud has rejuvenating qualities so that she can be on the front cover of Riverbank Heroes magazine.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Toad, Ratty, Mole and Hedge help Portly to find some bees to draw, but Toads hiccups ensure they cant get close enough for drawing or honey.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Chief is persuaded to take a day off and puts Tinker in charge of getting into Toad Hall. But Tinker has bigger plans than that!

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Hedge, Ratty, Mole and Toad go on a boat journey upriver to find the mysterious Song Stone.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Ratty boasts that he could take The Rats Nest out on a big adventure into the wide ocean, but when his friends encourage him to follow his dream, he reluctantly feels compelled to leave the riverbank.

programme.title: Tom And Jerry: Blast Off To Mars
programme.desc: After chasing each other as usual, Tom And Jerry find themselves trapped on a spaceship to Mars and end up having to save Earth from aliens!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean embarks on plenty of adventures, along with his sidekick, Teddy. They try to stay out of the way of Mrs Wicket and her cat Scrapper, but often end up in trouble.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is at a farmers’ market with Irma at her knitwear stall – right next to a man selling novelty teapots. Bean is instantly smitten with a green car-shaped one but can’t afford it. When he visits a food truck that’s laid out free samples, he hatches a plan to swipe them and sell them on his own stall so he can raise the cash for the teapot of his dreams!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Animated antics. Mrs. Wicket thwarts Mr. Beans plans to watch his favourite TV show.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean peers through the window of the opening party of an art exhibition and sees free snacks being handed around – yum! But he’s told by the bouncer that he needs to be smartly dressed. So he sneaks into the artist’s studio and paints a tuxedo onto himself. This time he’s let in, but will Bean’s fake painted suit last long enough for him to get his free food?

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: The gang is practicing to play Saturn Dance with Priya when she calls to tell them she is sick. She wont be able to come. Ella is very disappointed and wonders how they can cheer up Priya.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: The Universe is full of explosions that both create and destroy. This is a countdown of 10 of the biggest, most powerful types of blasts to rock the cosmos.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ruins in Peru support legends of a sunken UFO base and Indian texts talk of water worlds populated by humans and aliens. Could aquatic cities prove that aliens visited?

programme.title: Secret History Of Humans
programme.desc: 15,000 years ago man and the wolf form a partnership that shapes the future of Mankind. With the help of mans new best friend we domesticate more animals, sowing the first seeds of farming and civilisation.

programme.title: Secret History Of Humans
programme.desc: The ability to share complicated ideas allowed early man to hunt, farm and build communities. And the creation of things like an alphabet and the printing press allow Mankind to further expand, leading to the proliferation of ideas and revolution.

programme.title: Cities Of The Underworld
programme.desc: Go beneath the jungles of Belize to uncover burial tombs, sacrificial altars, ritualistic caves and the literal entrances to the Mayan underworld.

programme.title: Gold Hunters: Legend Of The Superstition Mountains
programme.desc: Hunting for the Lost Dutchman is usually a one-man journey, but Wayne Tuttle is partnering with a team of experts to follow a newly-revealed clue that could finally solve the 500-year-old mystery of Americas most famous buried treasure.

programme.title: Gold Hunters: Legend Of The Superstition Mountains
programme.desc: Hunting for the Lost Dutchman is usually a one-man journey, but Wayne Tuttle is partnering with a team of experts to follow a newly-revealed clue that could finally solve the 500-year-old mystery of Americas most famous buried treasure.

programme.title: MonsterQuest
programme.desc: A search through the jungles of Central Africa for an elusive monster said to resemble an enormous, long-necked and four-legged saurpod dinosaur.

programme.title: Lost Worlds
programme.desc: Religion, mythology, art, power and science all influenced the Seven Wonders of the World. Their engineering still astounds us today.

programme.title: Gold Hunters: Legend Of The Superstition Mountains
programme.desc: A 200 year old treasure map leads Wayne and the team to a mysterious stone shaped like a heart with an X carved into its face; an investigation there leads to an unexpected discovery.

programme.title: MonsterQuest
programme.desc: Investigators try to compile evidence to prove that the elusive monster known as sasquatch exists, including videos, tracks, prints and maps of sightings.

programme.title: Lost Worlds
programme.desc: The Har at Megiddo gave its name to Armageddon, the final battle described in the book of Revelation. Trace the history of the cities built on this hilltop.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: Without the moon, the earth would be a very different and desolate place today: four hours of sunlight with pitch-black nights, steady 100mph winds spawning giant hurricanes lasting for months, and virtually no complex life forms, much less humans.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate the similarities in burial tombs from distant cultures, and question whether aliens could have influenced their complicated designs.

programme.title: Search For The Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira discover a previously unknown hidden chamber where they believe a giant skeleton may be buried.

programme.title: Chasing Mummies
programme.desc: Zahi is determined to disprove the theories of the so-called pyramidiots, who believe that there are secret underground chambers leading to the Sphinx. Little did anyone know that these caves were home to thousands of bats!

programme.title: Engineering An Empire
programme.desc: For more than 500 years, Rome was the most powerful and advanced civilisation the world had ever known, built by an unprecedented mastery of engineering and labour.

programme.desc: What are the enormous forces that generate catastrophic waves deep on the ocean floor? The 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami is estimated to have released the energy of 23,000 atomic bombs.

programme.title: Brad Meltzers Lost History
programme.desc: Host Brad Meltzer and viewers are on the hunt for lost and stolen history, including JFKs actual brain tissue and millions of dollars of gold coins stolen from the U.S. Mint. Plus, a remarkable violin from the Titanic.

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: All around the world are examples of physical evidence suggesting humans are not alone in the universe, but has this evidence been left behind for a purpose? Is it a series of clues we are meant to decipher? Giorgio A Tsoukalos investigates.

programme.title: The Curse Of Civil War Gold
programme.desc: A daring diving operation produces potential evidence of some 140 million dollars in gold at the bottom of Lake Michigan, while an informant shares a 50-year-old secret that shocks and energises the team.

programme.title: In Search Of Aliens
programme.desc: In 1958, a bulldozer operator in California discovered 16-inch human-like footprints, and the legend of Bigfoot was born. Today, there are hundreds of reported sightings, but nowhere are the stories more prolific than in Americas Pacific Northwest.

programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: With Peron toppled from power, Hitler and Bormann could have been forced to flee Argentina. Following leads from declassified files, Bob and John send the teams into Chile and Paraguay to investigate Hitlers whereabouts if he were forced to escape.

programme.title: The Universe: Ancient Mysteries Solved
programme.desc: Sodom and Gomorrah-a Biblical tale of two cities incinerated by a hail of fire and brimstone. Astronomers, archeologists and biblical scholars investigate the possible science behind the myth.

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Shipwreck Treasure Hunter
programme.desc: Ross tries to find out more about his sea-faring Great Grandfather, Arthur ‘Pop’ Chalmers. He discovers that Pop served in the Merchant Navy and survived three shipwrecks. Inspired to know more, he links up with maritime archaeologist, Mallory Haas.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When a seller comes in with a poster by Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec, will it make an impression on Rick, or will he bid adieu? Meanwhile, Chum unboxes some 1912 Yale baseball uniforms. Is it a home run, or a strike out?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Corey take a spin in the classic car Hells Chariot, from the movie Grease. Is the flaming hotrod the one that they want, or will they "drop out" of the deal? Then, Chum takes a whack at a Punch-A-Bag game once played by Jack Dempsey.

programme.title: Curse Of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: When the team deploys a cutting-edge new technology on Skinwalker Ranch to study the mysterious Bubble, it leads to an unsettling revelation.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: Is famous footage of the Mississippi Bigfoot the real deal? Why did the White House order a UFO to be shot down over Lake Huron? What will forensic testing reveal about the alleged alien corpses presented to the Mexican government?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient astronaut theorists have suggested that many of the divine beings depicted in cultures throughout the world are not really divine - or mythological - but instead reflect extraterrestrial visitations that our ancestors did not understand.

programme.title: Pawn Stars

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient Aliens is counting down ten of the most compelling UFO crashes that have been reported across the globe. From an acorn-shaped object that crashed in the woods of rural Pennsylvania, to a mysterious craft that washed ashore in Japan.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: In the early 1900s, Edgar claimed to receive visions of both the past and the future while in a trance, he healed the sick, and alleged to have encounters with otherworldly beings. Could it be that he was a vessel used to carry out an alien agenda?

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: In an all-UFO special, Tony Harris breaks down the latest developments and most compelling photographic evidence in a tumultuous year of UFO revelations. Did the most recent UAP incidents present a threat to national security?

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: From a Michigan man who was there, Mike learns about Evel Knievels rocket-powered Snake Canyon jump - and is determined to buy a one-of-a-kind billboard rescued from the site.

programme.desc: Lauras on her own in Moreno Valley, and shes anything but discreet about the reasons. Brandi cooks up a nice profit. Renes doll locker yields a couple surprises, while Ivy dabbles with a bit of the supernatural.

programme.desc: Roadmaster Rick: Rick and Corey discover an old Buick Roadmaster, Chum checks out a doll and volleyball signed by Tom Hanks and a samurai sword lands on the counter. (S24, ep 10)

programme.desc: With technological advancements, humanity has entered a new era in the search for life outside of our planet. From the discovery of exoplanets and the exploration of the moon, could man’s quest to understand the universe be built into our DNA?

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: There are many puzzling artefacts from around the world that challenge everything known about the technological capabilities of distant ancestors. Some ancient objects are so mysterious theyve spawned endless debate and theories.

programme.desc: Rick battles over a pair of vintage posters, but will he win the war? Then, Rick and Chum call on the power of Grayskull as they check out a large Battle Cat toy. Will the duo be cringing from sticker shock or be able to transform the negotiations?
