programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient Aliens is counting down ten of the most astonishing - and unexplainable - technologies in history. From mysterious golden orbs discovered in Mexico, to a sacred wooden box that could communicate with the heavens.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy is in the kitchen making a jam sandwich. He jumps to grab the sandwich from the side but accidentally loses his grip - whoops! Poor Messy, his sandwich is all over the floor! “But why do things always fall down and not up?” he asks and transports himself to Okido to find out. In Okido, Messy joins Zoe and Felix in the garden, who are stargazing at the night sky. They spot a shooting star. As it zips across the sky it starts to get bigger in size. Now it’s travelling towards them! “Duck”, shouts Messy, as it lands right in front of them.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: The twins birthday is approaching. Sour says she does not wish to share the birthday with Sweet. Sweet is sad that her sister feels that way but respects her wish. Sour initially enjoys having a birthday of her own and the activities the Berry girls plan for her, but gradually feels lonely without her sister, and regrets what she said earlier.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is disappointed to find that he is not able to join in with any of the activities his family are taking part in at home.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry is told to tidy his room he simply transfers all the mess into Dino-world, where he is told there is a no tidying up rule.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo discovers a reef manta ray pup in the garden. The Junior Rangers set sail to find the manta ray a home in the ocean, but what happens when Ranger Rocky gets stuck in a sea jelly bloom?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas is working on the Indian Railway and Charubala rewards him for always being early by giving him a very important job - delivering some precious silk to a famous fashion designer. But when Thomas sees swimming elephants on his journey, he gets so excited that he misses his turning and delivers the silk to the wrong station without realizing. Instead of listening to Ashimas advice and telling Charubala, Thomas attempts to sort out his mistake alone. He ends up getting himself into even more trouble by picking up the wrong cars/trucks, not listening to Noor Jehans warnings and continuing to not tell Charubala about the big mess he has caused. Finally he owns up to his mistakes and everyone helps him put things right!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas thinks that Raul the Brazilian tank engine is fun because he turns every boring task into a game.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Some sheeps escaped from Mr. Guellecs field. The farmer is torn as he cant watch the herd and fix the broken fence which allows the sheep to run away at the same time.Its a perfect mission for Grisu who will learn to be a shepherd, with Stellas help. But the task isnt a piece of cake since the sheep dont want to listen to him at all. They rush away throughout the streets of Dragontown, causing troubles. Grisu and Stella have to discover how to steer a herd, especially a stubborn black sheep. Not an easy mission but as ever, a fire fighter never gives up!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: The Dragon Stone, a beautiful and rare stone that Grisus ancestors found centuries ago breaks accidently. It was supposed to be the main stone of an exhibition that Professor Smeraldo has set up. To avoid cancelling the exhibition, Grisu, Fume and Stella go to explore a cave where they might find another legendary Dragon Stone. But the expedition turns into an adventure when they realize that only the two kids are able to go through the very small entrance of the cave. The quest quickly appears to be a big task for such young kids, even if one of them is a dragon. But thanks to their tenacity (fire-fighters never give up!), Grisu and Stella will be able to find the legendary stone and to find their way back. The exhibition will be saved!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s Spring blossom season and the pretty pink blossoms that come floating down the stream remind Big Nutbrown Hare of a magnificent cherry tree from his youth. He sets off cross- country to find it, with Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, but the journey is longer and harder than he remembered. Will the blossoms floating downstream give them a clue as to a shorter way home?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends go on a hunt for treasure in the meadow and collect all kinds of unique gems like flowers, feathers, apples and egg-shells. But there’s a hole in Little Nutbrown Hare’s leaf-bag and he loses the precious collection along the way. Luckily, Big Nutbrown Hare is not far behind to collect the lost treasure as well as follow its trail to find his son.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Woodsy has had enough of Berry telling the parents when he does something he shouldnt. Following Loudo’s advice, he devises a good way to stop this tale-telling. Now, when Berry tells tales about him, no one will believe her… But is this really a good idea ?

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: JJ and Mila are training for a snowboarding stunt show to be performed at the opening of the Winter in Spring Festival - a celebration of winter in Spring City. Bob and the team will be building a triple chairlift to transport passengers to the top of Observatory Hill. But Bob isn’t keen on the cold weather - he’d much prefer to be building sandcastles on the beach! During a work break, Skye offers Bob a snowboarding lesson - and he’s terrible! Meanwhile, Scoop is determined to have a slide down the snowy hill - but Wendy warns him that without snow chains, he’ll have no control. Scoop can’t resist... and ends up sliding all over the slope and crashing into a support beam, causing the chairlift cable to jump off the wheel tracks.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his crew are finishing off the new penguin pool at Spring City Zoo. It’s almost complete when Lofty accidentally drops a large rock, which smashes the observation window. It’s urgent that they fix it quickly because the penguins will be arriving any moment. Meanwhile Mayor Madison and Mr. Bentley are entertaining a special visitor, the grouchy Mayor Snipe from Riverdale. They take him on a tour of the city, but he isn’t impressed with the castle, the sports stadium or the revolving restaurant.Back at the zoo the penguins have arrived, but the pool isn’t ready for them yet. Leo has been busy working on a new pond and water feature at The Town Hall, and Lofty suggests the penguins can stay there until their new home is ready.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Trying to figure out what a strange piece of metal with a number 10 on it is, Huckle and his pals take it to Blacksmith Bear who helps them discover strange writing on it. Figuring it must be a foreign language, they take it to Ms Honey and, with her help, determine the piece of metal is a lost tap from Hilda’s French tap dance shoes./Huckle and pals set out to find the whistle blower who is causing a traffic jam.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers head to the ocean to find a home for a young scalloped hammerhead shark. Unfortunately, the adventure takes a wet turn when the hammerhead shark gets caught in a shrimp net.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo comes across an eastern spotted skunk while playing a game of mini-golf in the garden. The Junior Rangers pop by the prairie to find a suitable home for the skunk, but an unfriendly coyote could put a dent in their plans.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: The doctor has come to give Simon and his little brother their yearly vaccination. Seeing that the boys are scared, the doctor suggests that Simon be his assistant! Simon takes his new role very, very seriously, even though the doctor himself does some pretty silly stuff. The two of them work so well together that Gaspard relaxes completely and the doctor is able to give him his vaccination shot without the little rabbit even noticing. Same for Simon who braves it out like a champ. Ha, doesn’t even hurt!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, catches a cold on a gloomy, rainy day. Doctor Owl examines her and advises her to rest a lot in bed. Her friends visit often to take care of her, and Flutter always asks them to read from her new book. Soon, everyone knows the story, which tells of a ball held in a splendid castle. One day, Balthazar makes Flutter sad by saying that the princess story is just a fairy tale. Flutter turns away, disappointed, and falls asleep. Balthazar meets Doctor Owl, who notices that something is bothering him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Mama Owls chicks are born, and soon they are strong enough for Berry and Dolly to visit them. Doctor Owl asks for their help while he works. The owl babies are very lively, and Berry and Dolly play with them enthusiastically and patiently. At lunchtime, Mama Owl is running out of patience, but eventually, they manage to feed the chicks. After finishing lunch and resting a little, the little ones regain their energy. They happily jump around Mama Owl, who feels it is time that the chicks learn to fly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, plays beautifully on his violin for the forest inhabitants, but one day, no one listens to his new piece. First, he looks for Berry, Balthazar, and Stanley, but they are busy. He goes to Dolly, but she doesn’t have time either. Very discouraged, he decides to leave the forest. However, he meets the Magpie, who welcomes him and cheers him up. Meanwhile, the others begin to search for Alfonso. When they find him, they apologize and invite him to play his new piece at the playground opening.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One autumn day, Reggie Squirrel is visited by his old friend, Otto Badger, who brings a frisbee as a gift. They happily play with it, and when they head home, the frisbee falls at the base of a tree. Later, Berry and his friends find it and play with it, but Balthazar throws it so far that the frisbee vanishes. Reggie Squirrel asks them about it later, but Balthazar denies having seen it. Dolly and Flutter find the frisbee and bring it back to Reggie. Berry, feeling ashamed, admits that they accidentally threw the frisbee and couldnt find it. In the end, they all play happily with it until dark, carefully making sure not to throw it too far.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Leapy, the grasshopper girl, gets paint on her hair while painting her house in the spring. She can’t wash it off, so Zephyr, the dragonfly, offers to cut her hair. Leapy is very sad when she sees herself in the mirror; she doesn’t like her new hairstyle. At Zephyrs suggestion, they show the others, but only Dolly notices the change and compliments her. Later, they hold a hairstyle day, where everyone creates special hairstyles for themselves. Leapy happily finishes painting her house and invites her friends to a spring feast.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Stanleys birthday is approaching, and he becomes very curious and can’t wait to find out what gift he will receive from Dolly. He peeks into the ladybird girls drawer. The next day, he tells Balthazar that he knows what his gift will be. On his birthday, the friends gather and wish Stanley a happy birthday. Flutter presents the cake, they sing, and then Stanley blows out the candles and cuts the cake. Stanley receives many nice gifts, including a bowling set from Dolly. Stanley admits that he peeked into the ladybird girls drawer because he was curious about his gift.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Shaun invites his friends to Sand Island during the summer heatwave. Christopher and Chloe, the two canaries, ferry the friends over. Bubble, Balthazar, Dolly, Stanley, Berry, Flutter, and Shaun build sand houses. Balthazar accidentally knocks down Bubble the flower beetles house. Suddenly, a summer shower begins and washes away all the sand houses. They stand sadly around their ruined creations and decide to build a large drip sandcastle together. Side by side, they build drip towers, construct castle walls, and decorate the tops with sand balls. The day passes joyfully, and by the evening, when the canaries come to pick them up, magnificent drip towers stand tall on the island.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunnys friends gather for a cake party.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is "Its a Bing thing!" which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are both tired but insist on one last game of Hide and Seek before bed. Pando finds a great hiding place under the covers of Bing’s bed but by the time Bing finds him he’s fast asleep. Bing is tired too and gets upset when he thinks there’s nowhere left for him to sleep, but Flop and Padget find a way.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula help Amma to get lunch ready. Bing watches yummy peas and delicious carrots go into the pot, but when lunch is served theyre all mixed up together and Bing doesnt like it.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is a clever and intelligent mouse who lives in a tiny house at the base of the church wall with her pet Snaily and her best friends.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda finds a bottle containing a treasure map in the stream. She excitedly shows Rupert her discovery and the two go on a treasure hunt. They turn Wild Rose Lane on its head, but theres no treasure to be found. After hours of searching in vain, the pair recover with a tasty picnic in Tildas garde, where Tilda finally decodes the complicated map.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tildas Great Great Aunt Emily is visiting Wild Rose Lane. Rupert suggests they have a competition to decide which of the two mice bakes the better cheesecake. While Emily sets to work in Ruperts kitchen, Tilda discovers an old recipe from her ancestor Eusebia which sounds better than her own.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Days On a hot Summer’s day Big Nutbrown Hare wants the young ones to have some relaxing time by the river. Like most young kids they have trouble staying quiet and still. When they do finally manage some quiet time, they experience the variety of life that the river has to offer, including some rare birds and a family of terrapins.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare wakes up to a colourful sprig of holly in the snow outside the hollow log. It’s surprise gift from Little Spotty Deer, who has returned to the meadow. This gives Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse the idea to spread the joy and surprise all their other friends with a holly sprig too, so the three of them make a game of it. Theme: Spreading fun and joy.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Day It is the shortest day of the year so the sun doesnt rise until very late and is going to set very early. To Little Nutbrown Hare everything feels mixed up and theres no time to do all the things he wants to do. That’s until he and Little Field Mouse name it Topsy-Flopsy Day and decide to make a fun and funny day of it!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn his Training Badge, Wilson must teach Hoot and Toot how to use the paint car. Unfortunately, he’s so busy demonstrating how good he is at painting, he doesn’t teach them anything. He realises his mistake when time is nearly up – he should have been showing them instead of showing off! Wilson sadly goes through a list of all the things he should have taught them. Hoot and Toot listen closely and surprise Wilson by passing their test. Wilson earns his badge after all!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Jayden is about to take a bite of his peanut butter sandwich before things take an unexpected turn when a crafty raccoon snatches his comms device. Simultaneously, Leo and Katie engage in a decluttering activity in the garden, pondering which possessions to keep or give away. They receive a call from Jayden but instead of seeing Jayden on the screen, it’s the raccoon on the run! Confused, this prompts the Junior Rangers swift response. They arrive and meet with a tired and lost Jayden who shows them the direction the raccoon went. This leads them near a road where the raccoon runs in the middle of it, which raises the rangers’ concerns about relocating the raccoon. They meet up with Ranger Rocky who calls Ranger Joey to provide insights into raccoon behavior and habits. Jaydens ingenious use of a peanut butter and jelly sandwich to bait the raccoon into giving back the comms device works but Ranger Rocky intervenes and reminds them not to feed wildlife but the raccoon scurries off. The day concludes with a successful mission and Leo, Katie and Hero continue with sorting their stuff and Hero lets go of his unused toy.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah, navigating the scorching Thar Desert, finds Hardwickes Spiny-Tailed Lizards seemingly braving the intense heat. Concerned for their well-being, she contacts Leo and Katie who are in the garden about to commence in a water gun chase but are interrupted when Hero steals the water gun. Upon consulting the computer, they learn that the lizards need sunlight to regulate their body temperature. During the call, a falcon appears and scares the lizards back into their burrows! Leo, Katie and Hero fly to the desert to help the lizards find a way to stay in the sun without being harmed by the falcon. Attempting to aid them, they construct a tent, only for it to crash to their disappointment. They meet with Ranger Rocky who seeks advice from Ranger Joey, they discover the importance of sunlight for these cold-blooded creatures. A lizard approaches the rangers, trusting them enough to be around them when suddenly the falcon swoops in towards it! Hero intervenes to protect the lizard from the falcon and it flies off. With Ranger Rockys assistance, they come up with a new plan to keep the falcon away instead of protecting the lizards. With CDs hung on a tree, it reflects light which scares the falcon. The lizards can now safely bask in the sun, marking the success of the mission. In the Treehouse, a water gun fight ensues between Leo and Katie.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are planning to go on a picnic with Nina’s donkey Coquelicot but the animal is stubbornly refusing to leave its enclosure! So the two friends decide to pamper it to get it to loosen up, hoping it will then be more inclined to move! But it’s no good: the nervous donkey simply refuses to budge an inch!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: This morning, T’choupi notices that the pretty drawing Lalou sent him through the mail has been chewed! But who’s the culprit?! Nina argues that none of her animals could have done it but T’choupi is certain it’s one of the pets at Nina’s house. And he’s determined to find out which one! He gets a surprise when he finds out that the little nibbler is not a usual suspect!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi, Nina and Mom are busy sowing seeds in the small vegetable garden. But a bird keeps coming along and pecking them up as soon as they’ve been sown! So T’choupi and Nina decide to build a scarecrow to protect the seedbeds. They go about it in secret (although with Dad’s help) to give Mom a nice surprise. However, they get a disappointment when they realize their scarecrow isn’t scary at all!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Today is the school fair and Charley dreams of winning the prize his covets most at the raffle: spinning tops!! But luck seems to be against him and instead he wins… a doll! He will succeed in getting his tops in the end… but not in a way that he should feel proud of…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia is angry with Sam who stepped on her tail. Sam hurt her and she lost her balance. Julia doesnt want to talk to him anymore! As best he can, Sam tries to make up with his friend.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Miss Gossip wants to write an article about Julia, as a recent inhabitant. The journalist needs informations about her island, from a book that belong to Julias mother, so not to be loosed...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas and Edward decide to teach Gordon a lesson after he refuses to thank Edward for rescuing him from Gordon Hill, despite previously berating the smaller engine for being old and unreliable.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Annie and Clarabel are always complaining to Thomas about going too fast. Thomas likes to tease them, by going too fast or too slow (so Annie and Clarabel will ask him to go faster again). But when Annie and Clarabel find themselves coupled to Caitlin by mistake, they get a taste of what going fast is really like, and poor Thomas gets frightened that they might be taken to the mainland forever.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou is at a pottery studio with Mommy and he wants tomake his dad the best present ever for Fathers Day. Except pottery isa lot harder than it seems! Wow. After a big mess, he learns that itsbetter to go slow at first, that practice makes perfect, and that,actually, things dont have to be perfect to be great.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: It’s Leo’s birthday, and Caillou is having his very first Sleepover! Heattends the sleepover with Leo’s cousin, who is a wheelchair user.Pretty soon after arriving, Caillou accidentally spills his juice onthe carpet. He panics, and rather than admitting the mistake to Leo’smommy, he covers up the stain with Leo’s wrapped up gifts.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Forgetful Mayor Fox has misplaced the giant key to the city that hes supposed to be presenting to a visiting astronaut. Huckle and his pals try to figure out where he set it down. They learn that Mayor Fox did one thing while touring a candy factory that required both his hands - stirring a huge pot of candy goo. Not far away they find a big chocolate-covered key./When Busytown residents are baffled by mysterious door knocking, Huckle and gang discover who it is.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: We see Parrot packing a picnic basket, Mole appears and suggests taking a magnifying glass so they can explore nature and all of its small wonders. When they arrive they spread out the food. Monkey turns to thank Parrot for the sandwich, when he looks back he discovers the food is gone leaving only a trail of crumbs. Monkey follows the crumbs until he gets to Mouse.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When James plans a cafe makeover for the Wholefish Cafe, he becomes over-zealous which leads to a series of events that cause a fire. Meawhile, the fire team undertake training on the fire station emergency slide, but Steele is a bit nervous.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: On a wildlife sketching trip, Norman wants to find the most spectacular creature to sketch, but this gets a bit tricky when Lily Chen tags along.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family

programme.title: Doodleboo

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What was a cavemans favorite attraction? Doodleboo explains how to draw a funny dinosaur

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who is the king of hide and seek in the forest? Doodleboo explains how to draw a squirrel.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave bake a carrot cake for the Little Bunnies to help them say thank you to their Mom on Mother’s Day, for being such a great Mom. Following Hatty’s special recipe they seek out all the right ingredients, check the quantities they need and mix them all up in Hatty’s magic hat to make the perfect bake!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave are excited about going to school to learn new things. When the teacher fails to show up, Hatty invites Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave to take it in turns at being teacher themselves. They have fun sharing facts about dogs, birds and bananas, and by the end of the day are amazed by how many interesting things they already knew!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is disappointed when a trail of ants disappears with the delicious Spring berries he’s found. He’s convinced that ants are not very nice, and only after Big Nutbrown Hare explains how the ants were probably taking the berries home to their families does Little Nutbrown Hare forgive them. And when he sees how clever the ants are, he soon wants to be like them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The Summer meadow is home to a many amazing treasures of nature. When Little Nutbrown Hare finds a beautiful blue butterfly, he and Little Field Mouse go on a hunt for other blue treasures to bring back and show Big Nutbrown Hare, including blueberries, blue bells and even blue eggshells. Meanwhile, Big Nutbrown Hare has discovered the biggest blue treasure of them all. What could it be?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare wakes early one Summer morning before the sun has risen. Big Nutbrown Hare sends Little Nutbrown Hare off to invite his friends for breakfast so he can rest a little longer. Along the way Little Nutbrown Hare discovers how wonderful and different all his friends homes are. Will Little Nutbrown Hare still love his own home as much as he did?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are in the park playing at being giants and splashing in puddles with their big welly boots. As they play the puddles get bigger and bigger until Bing slips over in the mud and gets wet everywhere. Amma comes to the rescue with a giant warm bath and a giant carroty bagel.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop teaches Bing and Pando how to blow bubbles. Bing finally blows a big bubble but gets upset when Pando pops it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula head off for a picnic at the paddling pool with Flop. But when they get there, they are shocked to find there is no water inside. Bing’s disappointment soon gives way to the realisation that it’s a very special pool day. With no water there are all sorts of games they can play that are usually against the pool rules.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: During Bing’s bedtime routine he inadvertently pees on his blankie and it’s too wet to wash and dry before bed. Fortunately his Hoppity Voosh toy has a cape just as soft and huggy as blankie and it even smells just right too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco shows Bing how to do really good Big Boos and together they make Flop jump. When Bing tries out his new tricks on Charlie he finds out the power of Boo has to be scaled down for babies.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: It’s December, and it’s gingerbread time! Berry and Dolly love making them. Berry’s house filled with the wonderful smell of the biscuits what the magpie immediately noticed from above. Grabbed the bowl and flew away with it. Oh my!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a summer afternoon after a heavy storm Leapy, the grasshopper found an injured stranger, He immediately called for help. Berry and Dolly arrived in no time as always.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do

Monkey decides to bring the cub back to its pack in the tundra.

programme.desc: When Professor Pickles decides to create an EPIC historical walking trail, he doesnt realise that his decision to use real props instead of cardboard ones will result in an emergency of EPIC proportions!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While looking for a lost toy under a bunch of crates, Nina and T’choupi discover some very strange hairs belonging to some unidentified animal … In a mystery, the two friends head off to inspect all the animals of the hamlet in an attempt to track down the owner of the strange fur... programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Blindfolded, T’choupi is having the time of his life playing Blind Man’s Bluff with Nina and Luce!... Until he falls over… right in the nettles! Owieee! programme.title: Tilda Appleseed

programme.desc: When her little girl says she wants to become a doctor, mom tells her that it takes a lot of work. Surely enough, Girl decides to start training right away, with her first aid kit. So how about becoming a doll doctor?

programme.title: The Triplets

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Detective Caillou investigates the case of the missing bouncy ball -and everyone in the family is a suspect!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Snow comes early to the Island of Sodor – and it is heavier than usual! Donald and Douglas are coupled back-to-back with a van between their tenders and snowploughs on their fronts. Donald and Douglas keep squabbling about which line they should clear first, culminating in a big argument. Donald pulls away hard, snapping a damaged coupling and moving away with Douglas’s tender! So Douglas is left behind in the snow – without coal or water! The time apart helps cool the brothers’ tempers. They are delighted to be reunited in the end – and share water and coal from their tenders. Brothers!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: This lunchtime, T’choupi refuses to eat the fish Dad has cooked, supposedly because it doesn’t look tasty. But Mom insists: T’choupi can’t say he doesn’t like it if he hasn’t even tried it! So, when his parents aren’t looking, T’choupi slips his piece of fish to Ciboulette the cat, who just happens to be passing by at that moment. There we are – no-one’s any the wiser, mumbles T’choupi with a sigh of relief. But when, a short time later, he notices poor little Ciboulette has a strange cough, he gets worried: did the fish he gave her to eat give her a stomach ache??!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle arrives at the beach on his ATV only to be disappointed by the sight of scattered trash. Reluctantly, he cleans up the mess while venting his frustration at the unknown culprit. As he heads back to his ATV, he encounters a curious raccoon but fails to get close to it as it scampers away at the sound of the trash bag. Curiosity gets the better of Kyle, leading him to investigate underneath his ATV. To his surprise, he discovers a partially buried nest of eggs. Meanwhile, in the garden, Leo and Katie prepare a bath for their beloved dog Hero. Much to their astonishment, Hero returns with a duckling in tow, leaving everyone perplexed. The duckling jumps into the bath, enjoying itself, and Hero finds himself torn between joining in or not. Amidst the confusion, Leo receives a call from Kyle, who informs him about the raccoon that laid the eggs. Skeptical at first, the Junior Rangers decide to gather more information using Katies computer. Convinced of the situations authenticity, they agree to meet up with Kyle to help him move his stuck ATV without disturbing the eggs. They strategize and come up with a plan to lift the ATV using it like a helicopter. Their efforts pay off, but as the eggs start to hatch, they notice the baby turtles heading in the wrong direction away from the ocean. Kyle attempts to intervene but is stopped by the arrival of Ranger Rocky, who emerges from the sea.

programme.desc: The sure way of stopping the arguments between Rosie and Scoutbadger is that Rosie’s parents get back together… at least that is what she will try and arrange…

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that he has grown a thick Winter coat, he and Little Field Mouse make a coat from moss to help other creatures in the meadow stay warm. They discover that everyone has their own ways of coping in the colder months, but Big Nutbrown Hare uses the coat as a picnic rug on the snow so they can enjoy a Winter feast.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is fascinated that his friend Little Grey Squirrel is going to stay in his dray all Winter long. He and Little Field Mouse decide to hibernate in the hollow log until Spring, but soon become bored and fidgety. Little Field Mouse gives up and plays in the snow. Will Little Nutbrown Hare manage to stay inside, or will he be tempted out as well?

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Racing is exciting, but not for everyone. When Boribon feels sad because he hasnt won first place, Annalee cleverly finds a way to cheer the little bear up.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: As a young fisherman, GrandPa was thanked by a king for having saved him from the pirates. The monarch offered him two large rubies that he hid in the residence. Can Sam and Julia find them?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam is passionately reading a book. But Julia accidentally damages the last few pages of it. How Julia could she reinvent for her friend the end of the interrupted story to calm Sams frustration?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Mom is having a dinner party at home tonight and she is running all over the place to finish cleaning the house in time. When she goes out to do a round-trip to the bakery, the Triplets decide to give her a hand. But nothing goes as planned: the vacuum cleaner brakes, the couch is stained and the corridor is full of soap. Be careful Mom, the floor is very very slippery!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: An animal and pets magazine is organizing a wonderful contest to win a subscription: you have to send them a picture of your dog and relate its achievements. The Triplets decide to photograph Toto but cannot seem to find what he can do. Would he have what it takes to assist firemen? Policemen? Or detectives? Oh no! Just thinking about it makes Toto tremble with fear. The Triplets must think fast, there are only a few hours left to participate. But suddenly it hits them: of course, Toto is a hug specialist!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Brewster practices track laying by himself, while the Chuggineers work near Rocky Ridge River. Suddenly a storm rolls in and torrential rain lashes down. The riverbank bursts and water pours down the hill, washing away the temporary track that connects the Chuggineers to the main line. Brewster tries to lay more track to reach them, but the ground is too soggy. Chuggers help to sandbag the riverbank to stop the flow of water. When Brewster rolls over a sandbag, it gives him an idea. With the water flow already stemmed, Brewster lays sandbags on the soggy ground and puts track on top. It doesn’t sink. The rescued Chuggineers are amazed at Brewster’s ingenuity and track laying skills.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sergeant Ravani announces that a special surprise guest star will be coming to the Big Pontypandy Festival to sing with Elvis! / It’s the Pontypandy Ocean Parade and Hannah is determined to beat the other vessels to the finish with her Submaster 2000.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Professor Pickles decides to create an EPIC historical walking trail, he doesnt realise that his decision to use real props instead of cardboard ones will result in an emergency of EPIC proportions!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Pig is very proud of his new purple woolly sweater and shows it off to Kipper. Arnold spots a big red arrow, and then another, and they follow them into the woods. Pig doesn’t notice he has caught his sweater on a branch. The arrows were Tiger’s idea and he laughs at them from a tree he’s hiding in. Then he realises they’re lost. The unravelled wool from Pig’s sweater leads them back home.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Jake has lost something in the park – it’s a surprise so he can’t tell Kipper and Tiger what it is. They find a treasure map signed by Bluebeard the pirate and follow the clues. When they all meet up again Kipper and Tiger realise Jake lost the map. The treasure hunt was to be a surprise for Kipper’s birthday, but Jake’s even go the date wrong!

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: While at the grocery store with Mommy, Caillou sees Ms. Martin outside of school for the first time. Feeling shy, he hides from her and pretends to be a secret agent where Double-O Teddy helps him learn that it’s okay to feel shy, but it’s not okay to be unkind.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: After suggesting a game that Tina might have trouble playing with her prosthetic arm, an anxious Caillou insists they play the one game he knows she likes – Space Captain! In their space fantasy, Caillou learns that Tina is capable of more than he thought, if she’s given the opportunity to try.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Duck gets stuck on some flooded track, James is sent to fetch Rocky to rescue him. But James doesn’t wait for Rocky to secure his crane arm and they end up knocking down a signal before they arrive at the accident site. Without a signal to warn them, the other engines don’t stop, and what began as one small accident for Duck soon escalates into a much bigger one involving several other engines!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In New Zealand, Kyle practices his boomerang skills on the beach, but it gets carried away into the forest. While searching for it, he stumbles upon two Yellow-Eyed Penguins in the middle of the forest with one shooing the other away. Puzzled by their presence, Kyle contacts the Junior Rangers, who, in the Garden, are dealing with Heros impatience for his repaired jetpack. During the call, they learn that the penguin might be looking for its nest but suddenly, it scurries off towards the beach. The team travels to New Zealand in PlatypusOne to assist Kyle and the penguin but it’s nowhere to be found now. They try to figure out where the nest could be while the poor lost penguin checks nests of other penguin and gets shooed off everytime. As an attempt to look for it better, they use their jetpacks, and Kyle climbs a tree to search from higher ground but discovers no leads. With help from Ranger Rocky and information from Ranger Joey, they decide to look inland and use PlatypusOne to search from a birds’ eye view and eventually, they successfully locate the penguin’s fledgling and nest which results in a heartwarming reunion. Back at the Treehouse, Leo hangs a picture of the new penguin friend, celebrating another successful wildlife rescue. Meanwhile, Hero, now equipped with a fixed jetpack, flies excitedly in the garden but gets himself stuck in a tree.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the Alaskan wilderness, Jayden witnesses a grizzly bear cub being swept away in a river. Hero, Leo, and Katie, in the Garden, are practicing a search and rescue mission, with Heros flotation device when Jayden contacts them about the cub’s emergency. After a quick info segment about grizzly bears, they travel to Alaska in PlatypusOne. They try to chase after the cub but the river then divides into two ways. Unsure which way the cub went, the team split up with Katie and Hero flying ahead with their jetpacks to find the cub. Leo and Jayden then encounter Ranger Rocky who suggests they seek advice from Ranger Joey. Hero comes back to the boys and signals that he didn’t find the cub. Katie then joins them and warns them that the cub is approaching dangerous rapids. Hero is tasked to find the mother bear while the team rushes to the cub. When they reach the cub, it’s clinging to rocks as the rapids are pulling it away. They drop Heros flotation device and Hero practices his rescue skills, enabling the cub to safely reunite with its mother. Back at the Treehouse, they hang a picture of the rescued cub and its mom, concluding the successful mission and in the Garden, Hero is enjoying his well deserved time in the pool.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Meeras expecting a gecko to arrive and has got a tank all ready to greet her new pet.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Mrs Goggins is really missing her home town in Scotland.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When the children make Eggy heads with eggs and cress seeds, Bing gets impatient and wants his cress to grow quicker so he decides to give Eggy lots of water with the garden hose.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunny gets jealous when Sula gives Pando more attention on a playdate. He tries to gain some for himself and ends up being pushed, so Amma show them how to get rid of the anger

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is playing the talking lettuce game on Flops phone when he drops the phone and accidentally breaks it

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends put on a show in the park. After Coco’s dance, Pando’s song and Sula’s acrobatics display everyone is excited to see Bing’s finale. When he gets up on the stage Bing is overcome with stage fright so his friends, and rainbow fairy mice, come to the rescue.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing tries to show Sula she doesnt need to wear earmuffs to watch the fireworks but when a loud bang sends Bing flying, he doesnt think they are such a bad idea!

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Weenie play a game of hide and seek that unexpectedly turns into a game of lost and found when Weenie disappears. Worried, Oswald looks all over Big City in search of his pet and finally finds him – fast asleep under Johnny’s car seat. After making sure that Weenie knows never to hide in vehicles again they all celebrate with free ice cream!

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and weenie have overslept only to find that everyone else in Big City has also overslept (well, not everyone – Daisy always gets up with the sun!) After waking Henry up, the gang walk through the deserted streets of Big City and reach Alarm Clock Building where they discover that the clock has mysteriously stopped. With the help of his friends, Oswald climbs inside the clock tower to discover the root of the problem – a sleeping squirrel!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his crew are finishing off the new extension to the Spring City Museum. They are awaiting the delivery of its first exhibit – a full sized Tyrannosaurus Rex skeleton. Mr. Bentley has come out in his lunch break to supervise the arrival of the skeleton. But while Bob is back at his yard Leo discovers to his horror that Mr. Bentley has bungled the dimensions of the doors to the new extension, and now they are unable to get the huge dinosaur skeleton inside. Lofty suggests taking the skeleton to pieces and reassembling the bones inside the building.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Jenny Dobbs, the zoo keeper, asks Bob to finish building the new bear enclosure at Spring City zoo. He plans a three-tiered natural habitat that resembles a rocky mountain, with a pool and cave for shelter. Scoop thinks the mountain needs to be a tall as possible in order to keep the bear happy, and he convinces Muck and Lofty to help him. Unfortunately they build it too high. The rocks and soil in-fill cant take the weight and the whole mountain collapses. Scoop apologises, but Bob quite likes the idea of a bigger structure and alters the design so they can re-build the mountain with four levels. They finish just in time as a crate carrying the bear arrives.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that he has grown a thick Winter coat, he and Little Field Mouse make a coat from moss to help other creatures in the meadow stay warm. They discover that everyone has their own ways of coping in the colder months, but Big Nutbrown Hare uses the coat as a picnic rug on the snow so they can enjoy a Winter feast.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is fascinated that his friend Little Grey Squirrel is going to stay in his dray all Winter long. He and Little Field Mouse decide to hibernate in the hollow log until Spring, but soon become bored and fidgety. Little Field Mouse gives up and plays in the snow. Will Little Nutbrown Hare manage to stay inside, or will he be tempted out as well?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: After a long quiet winter in the meadow Little Nutbrown hare announces that he can’t wait for winter to be over so he can enjoy the other seasons with their special treats to see, hear and taste. Will the sound of icicles tinkling in the wind, the taste of a frozen Winter berry and some very unusual tracks in the snow convince the little hare that Winter is just as special as the other seasons?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Discover new words and join in the activities with Timmy and his friends in this fun learning series developed by Aardman and the British Council, world expects in teaching English.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Peppino delivers pizzas faster than anyone in Busytown, so when the kids wait an unusually long time for their pizza to arrive, they figure something must be wrong at the pizzeria. But Peppino isnt there and neither is his delivery car. By following his delivery route, the kids ultimately find Peppino stuck in an elevator./‘Fairy dust’ and strange sightings has Hilda Hippo convinced there are real live fairies in Busytown Woods!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Its morning time in the real world and Messy wakes up to hear a noisy song bird chirping outside his bedroom window. “Who’s making all that noise first thing in the morning?” asks a grumpy Messy. He tries to start up a conversation with the bird until he realises he doesn’t understand what the bird is saying. “What’s the point of singing a song with no words?” asks Messy and he transports himself to OKIDO to find out.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: It’s a wet and gloomy day in the real world. Messy is watching from inside whilst the rain pours onto his sandcastle he built earlier, it begins to melt. “Why does it have to rain?” sighs Messy. He transports himself to Okido to find out. The weather couldn’t be hotter in Okido. He greets Zoe and Felix in the garden who can’t wait to show Messy their beautiful sunflowers before the Mayor of Okido comes judge them in the City in Bloom competition this afternoon.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: When a comedy of errors causes Orange, Plum and Cherry to arrive late to their campout, they start off their annual tradition of telling tall-tales around the campfire by making up three outrageous, hysterical accounts of what held them up.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry accidentally smashes his mums favourite china teacup.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry needs help making up a story to go with his new drawing.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Ranger Rocky entrusts the Junior Rangers with a mission—return a mola to the ocean! The Junior Rangers take up the challenge, but find themselves having to wing it when some seagulls start pecking the mola.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When some of the engines think life would be easier without Diesel, he decides to teach them a lesson by hiding. But his plan backfires when none of the engines come looking for him! Diesel is painted with glow-in-the-dark paint and he plays a trick on the other engines... but Nia and Paxton surprise him in return!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Shane is having too much fun to stop and refuel; that is, until he runs out of coal and is stranded in the hot, red desert.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu has to look after Thingy while his mistress Olivia is away. Grisu has to take the dog to the pet grooming shop to take a bath. But Thingy is a stubborn dog. He refuses to move forward. Grisu And Stella will have to use kindness and to be smart enough to drive the dog through the town. Without listening to his father Fume, who tries to make him use his dragon flame...

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: The shooting of the movie “The monster of the Valley”, directed by the famous Quintin Ratatino, is going badly. A fire has destroyed his mechanical monster and his film crew has deserted the scene. Grisu and Stella help to save the movie. Grisu takes on the role of the monster and Stella helps with the technique. But playing the main part in a Ratatino’s movie is not that easy, evenmore when the director asks Grisu to play the role... of a nasty dragon!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse innocently pick lots of Spring flowers from a field and deliver bunches to their friends. When they realise that they are being followed everywhere by a cloud of yellow butterflies, they realise that the butterflies need the flowers, to feed from their nectar. How will they lead the little butterflies to more flowers and sweet nectar?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One clear Spring night, Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse settle in to enjoy Little White Owl’s story of adventure and treasures. Inspired by her tale, the two set out to try and touch the most special treasure of all – a shiny star. They climb higher and higher but the beautiful stars seem just out of reach. Will they find a way to get their wish?

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Basil, who has promised Rosie to go with her to find a rare leaf, hears Scoutbadger doubting his ability to keep his promises. To reassure Rosie, Basil decides to do even better than his promise, he will bring his daughter the most beautiful of rare leaves. Unfortunatley, he has problems and cannot make the rendezvous. Rosie is disappointed. Scoutbadger realises that he should not have doubted Basil and repairs his mistake…

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team arrive at the Racetrack to build three horse stables the day before a big race. At the sight of the horses, Leo goes into ‘cowboy mode’ for the duration of the build. Henry Corner, the anxious groom, wants the build to be as noise-free as possible for the sake of his nervy horses, which is exactly when the noisy Two-Tonne arrives in reverse. The build progresses well, until, getting carried away lassoing with some spare ropes, Leo scares the horses, who escape from their paddock and kick out at the nearly-built stables in their excitement. The stables collapse like dominos! Bob and Scoop have to round up the horses now galloping around the racetrack while Wendy’s quick thinking and Lofty’s help steers them back safely into their paddock. But the stables still need to be built all over again and now it’s nearly dusk. A contrite Leo thinks he may have a solution, but what?

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Roland’s Gifts is an internet gift shop; Bob, Leo, Scoop, Muck and Lofty are in its huge distrubution warehouse with owner, Roland Sweet. It’s a few days before Christmas and Roland has commissioned Bob and his team to install a hi-tech a robotic picking system, which will pick items off shelving, wrap them and put them into delivery vans via a chute. The system needs to be installed by evening the next day so customers receive their gifts in time for Christmas Day. Scoop and Muck are excited and do ‘robotic’ impressions; Leo claims to be very knowledgeable about robotics. During the installation Leo switches the system on to prove his knowledge to Scoop. Meanwhile an approaching snowstorm has moved the delivery deadline to that very evening.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Huckle and his pals all receive party invitations, but the partys location is a mystery. Small circular marks left behind by whoever delivered the invitations are an important clue. It leads Huckle and pals to Miss Honey whos been walking with a crutch. Grateful for the help she got raking up all her leaves, Miss Honey decided to throw a party for all the volunteers./Huckle and his pals discover a mysterious gigantic spoon.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo’s paper plane crashes into a young Malayan colugo. The Junior Rangers search the rainforest for the colugo’s mother, but the mission comes to a halt when they chance upon a forest fire. Will the Junior Rangers eventually succeed in their mission? Or will their plans go up in smoke?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo meets an oriental pied hornbill while picking apples in his garden. To find the hornbill’s nest, the Junior Rangers set out for the rainforest once again.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: In the box of “RocoChoco” cereal, Simon is trying to get his hands on the toy at the bottom. It’s a “Chocosaurus”, a little, plastic dinosaur. Since he already has this one, Simon runs over to Ferdinand’s to give it to him. But when the door opens, Ferdinand is standing there with Mamadou, Simon’s other best friend. And he too, wants the “Chocosaurus”! The two friends blackmail him into…picking his best friend! Simon is faced with a heck of a dilemma: who should he give it to? Finally, thanks to Mom’s help, he understands that he doesn’t have to chose ONE best friend. He is going to make a couple of “Simonosauruses” for both friends, so each of them will have one!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: At the end of summer, the Star Girl visits her friends. She rarely comes because her star-shaped house is in the sky. They spend a day together, and when night falls, the Star Girl bids everyone farewell. She can’t speak, but she plays the harp beautifully. The music will lift her house into the sky. However, this time one of the harp strings comes loose, and the house doesn’t rise. The Wind blows the string out of her hand, and she can’t catch it.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Centipedes apple tree hasn’t had any fruit for many years. He asks Berry for help, who carefully tends to the tree. At the beginning of summer, apples finally appear, and the Centipede is so happy that he invites his distant relative, the Millipede, for a visit. However, the Millipede falls ill and can’t come. The Centipede then invites his friends to a big apple party. When they arrive, they pretend that the Millipede was there, but it turns out that it was just his friends in costume.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Cave Spider and the tiny Spiderling are good friends, and one summer day they are walking on the mountaintop. Spiderling blows a dandelion at the Cave Spider, who falls and gets injured. Spiderling immediately seeks help from Doctor Owl, who determines that the Cave Spiders legs are bruised and prescribes two weeks of rest. Berry, Dolly, Stanley, and Balthazar help the Cave Spider get home. Dolly suggests they sew a large canopy so the Cave Spider can watch the ants end-of-summer fireworks from the air. Flutter, Leapy, Zephyr, and the others make the canopy, and on the night of the fireworks, they lift the Cave Spider up so he can enjoy the view from above.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a spring day, Alfonso finds an unknown seedling by the stream. The cricket carefully guards the plant, which soon produces a special flower. Alfonso waters and tends to it daily, happily watching it grow. One morning at the end of summer, Alfonso notices that the flower has wilted and its petals have fallen off. Sadly, he gathers the petals and brings them into the house. In the afternoon, Dolly visits him, and later his friends come over to cheer him up. They bring delicious pancakes, but Alfonso is still sad. They go out to the stream, and Alfonso scatters the flower petals into the water, bidding them farewell with tears.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: As the end of summer approaches, the Lightning Beetle visits the fireflies and surprises them with a new book about planets and stars. After a conversation, one little firefly, when the others were already asleep, sets out to conquer the sky, but becomes completely exhausted and crashes. Doctor Owl diagnoses him with a fever and possible pneumonia, so he stays with him to heal. The other fireflies decide to surprise him. With the help of Berry, Dolly, Balthazar, Stanley, Flutter, and Eddy, they make colourful orbs, and the Lightning Beetle crafts the Sun. They suspend the planets on a hoop, which Eddy rotates with a contraption. They also instal tiny lights, resembling stars.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Dolly goes for a walk, and finally she is enriched with a beautiful cherry and a good friend.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing falls in love with a lost dog he and Flop find in the park and decides he wants to keep her. When the owner turns up Bing is very upset when it comes to saying goodbye to his new friend.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When the children make Eggy heads with eggs and cress seeds, Bing gets impatient and wants his cress to grow quicker so he decides to give Eggy lots of water with the garden hose.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunny gets jealous when Sula gives Pando more attention on a playdate. He tries to gain some for himself and ends up being pushed, so Amma show them how to get rid of the anger

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is playing the talking lettuce game on Flops phone when he drops the phone and accidentally breaks it

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Edna asks Rupert to look after her sons Billy and Benny. No problem, thinks Rupert. They can play while he reads a book. But no sooner has Rupert sat down in his armchair than the little squirrels turn up with one request after another. First they want lunch, then they need to go to the loo, then they want to play.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is a clever and intelligent mouse who lives in a tiny house at the base of the church wall with her pet Snaily and her best friends.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is visited by her Great Great Aunt Emily. In honour of the occasion, all the friends have a game of Blind Mans Buff. Emily and Rupert have to take off their glasses. After the game, the two pairs of spectacles get mixed up and Emily and Rupert suddenly start suffering all manner of mishap: Rupert bites into an onion instead of an apple...

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: In Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends try to find an extra special place and extra special food for Feast Day celebrations. When things go awry and nothing seems special at all, they discover that the most important thing is to be able to celebrate with those you love. Theme: celebrating with those you love.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Can you guess how much I love you? Little Nutbrown Hare asks his father. Big Nutbrown Hare looks up at the big, old oak tree. As much as the Old Oak Tree is big? he asks. Little Nutbrown Hare holds up an acorn in triumph. No, as big as this acorn! He replies. Because this acorn will just keep growing and growing and growing.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One morning in the early Springtime, Little Nutbrown Hare wakes to find the air filled with a delightful smell. He and Little Field Mouse search all over the meadow, the woods and by the riverside to find the source of the wonderful smell. They discover all kinds of new and unexpected Spring scents… sweet, pretty and fresh, but will they find the one they are searching for?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Brewster learns about camouflage when he repaints the lizard’s house.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the lush Amazon Rainforest, explorer Peyos discovery of a rare orchid takes an unexpected turn when playful pygmy marmoset younglings snatch it away. Believing them to be babies, Peyo calls the Junior Rangers - Leo, Katie, and Hero who were in the Garden, having fun imitating dances with each other. The team learns about pygmy marmosets, the worlds smallest monkeys from the computer. Arriving in the Amazon, they help Peyo to reunite the younglings with their family but first, they have to catch them as they keep jumping away! A spirited chase ensues with Hero, Pico, and the Junior Rangers pursuing the mischievous monkeys. They stumble upon Ranger Rocky who successfully catches one of the monkeys. Ranger Joey shares valuable insights into pygmy marmoset behavior. They find the monkey family near a river by finding trees with holes in them caused by the monkeys. But suddenly, Peyo alerts Leo and Katie of the monkeys playing on a branch dangerously close to the river. The branch snaps but with swift action from Leo, the monkeys are saved and returned to their family. Back at the Treehouse, Leo calls it a mission accomplished and finds Katie dizzy from trying to imitate Hero chasing his tail.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Jayden explores a North American beach with a walking stick, encountering seals, and discovering a blind pup. Leo,Katie and Hero are playing Blind Mans Bluff in the Garden before getting a call from Jayden regarding the pup. From the computer, they learn about harbor seals and realize the pup may be lost since the mother is nowhere to be seen on the beach. Leo, Katie and Hero travel to the beach, where confusion arises about the pups behavior. They stumble upon Ranger Rocky who calls Ranger Joey as she clarifies the seal pups natural behavior, and Ranger Rocky suggests the mother might be finding food in the ocean. After the call with Ranger Joey, they can’t seem to find the pup! Concerned about the missing pup and Hero, the group splits up to search and eventually finds Hero playing Blind Man’s Bluff with the seal. Ranger Rocky surprises them as he shows them who he found, the pup’s mother returning from the ocean! Leo concludes the mission accomplished before joining Katie and Hero in another round of Blind Man’s Bluff.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While out playing in the forest, T’choupi and Nina come across a broken bird’s egg. Wooow! Look at that: a little chick has literally just been born! But wait a minute: this particular egg is blue, and as far as they know, birds don’t lay blue eggs… Could it be from another type of animal?? And if so, which one? Super excited, T’choupi and Nina start searching for the mysterious creature that laid this blue egg…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Today, T’choupi and his friends, Nina and Luce, must help Fred take his goats to a field a certain distance away. But when Loupiote the dog gets wounded and is unable to shepherd the goats, the kids are very disappointed. Until, all of a sudden, they get a brilliant idea: why don’t they stand in for Loupiote and play shepherd dog, to guide the goat herd to the grazing field?...!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: On a beach in Indonesia, Zari finds tide pools littered with rubbish and a stranded bamboo shark in one of the tide pools. In the Garden, Leo is engrossed in a cricket hunt but finds the cricket on top of a slide which Hero tries to climb up. They get a call from Zari as she tells them about the shark and its inability to climb up the tide pool wall. As they arrive, Leo attempts to scoop the shark out, but the shark ends up slipping away. Katie recalls that bamboo sharks can crawl on their fins. The team fills the tide pool to facilitate the sharks escape, only to encounter another hurdle—rubbish-filled tide pools blocking its way to the sea. Ranger Rocky intervenes, and calls Ranger Joey who shares insights into the bamboo sharks ability to survive out of the water for long periods of time. The team cleans the tide pools, ensuring a safe passage for the bamboo shark back to the sea. Back at the treehouse, Leo hangs a picture of the bamboo shark as Hero slides down the slide with the cricket on his head.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah discovers a mysterious jar containing a sparkly squid while cleaning her dirt bike at a Singaporean beach. Meanwhile, in the Hero Garden, Katie initiates a complex treasure hunt for Leo that ends with an unexpected twist—a new map inside a treasure chest. The rangers receive an emergency call from Farah, who finds the squid changing colors inside the jar. Concerned for the squids well-being, they consult the computer, and identifies the squid as a Bigfin Reef Squid. The team rushes to the beach, where Leo accidentally throws the jar into the ocean in an attempt to open it. They try to grab the jar into the ocean but to no avail when suddenly Ranger Rocky grabs it from underwater! They retrieve the jar but find the squid in a seemingly lifeless state. Ranger Joeys insights reveal that the squid is likely in shock and needs a dark, cool environment to recover. The rangers transport the squid to the ocean floor near a coral reef, witnessing its vibrant transformation and ensuring it finds a safe home. Back in the Treehouse, Leo hangs a photo of the Bigfin Reef Squid, and in the Garden, Katie gets frustrated as all the treasure chests she finds only have been full of maps.

programme.desc: Bing and Pando play on the swings together but when Pando takes longer than his turn, Bing gets angry and runs infront of the swings and gets bumped.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is building a tower of blocks when Coco takes some to make a rainbow. When Charlie wants to play with the blocks too, they decide to make a new game they can all play.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If youre very quiet and statue still, then the duckies will come. Today, Bing and Sula are at the park to feed the ducks. Sula is very good at standing still like a statue and only giving a small handful of food to the ducks when they come up to her. Bing, on the other hand, throws all the food into the water at once – not thinking that a big quacking goose will come along and eat it all in one bite!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its snack time for Bing so Flop suggests they make a smoothie. When Bings carrot accidentally gets put in the blender, hes upset to disover he cant have it back.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: On a very windy day in Big City, Oswald and Weenie volunteer to look after baby Catrina while Madame Butterfly goes back to the Diner for her blanket. Oswald buys a balloon as a present for Catrina but a strong wind carries Catrina and the balloon off high into the sky! Oswald and Weenie commandeer a hot air balloon to try and catch Catrina who flies further and further away from Big City until they all eventually reach outer space! Oswald and Weenie finally rescue Catrina and manage to hitch a ride back to big City on a shooting star.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Henry is taking a special picture of the gang in front of Big City’s geyser. While waiting around for their picture to be taken they decide to play a ball game but Weenie gets all covered in mud! Oswald tries to give Weenie a bath, but she doesn’t want to take one. After chasing her around Big City and getting himself and his friend all wet in the process, Oswald finally manages to get Weenie clean again and everyone has their picture taken.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are completing work on a brand new fitness trail in the sports stadium park. They must finish before the afternoon’s Spring City Fun Run - a steeplechase across the fitness trail obstacle course, organised by Scoop’s idol Skye Sampson, a fitness guru and world champion record-breaking athlete. When Scoop is told that only humans will be competing, he sets up his own competition: the Muscle Machine Games! With events including “Weightlifting” (with a pallet of wooden beams) and “Discuss Throw” (with an old tyre) Lofty and Muck both break new records...

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mayor Madison has arranged for Ballroom Blitz, TV dance sensation, to come on tour to Spring City. When star dancer, Sylvain de Souza, threatens to cancel the show unless he gets a sprung dance floor, Maria enlists Bob to save the day, in return for a show tango with her hero. Dance fever sweeps Team Bob and the Spring City Rockets but Lofty despairs of ever being able to dance as well as the others. Just as he finds his dancing mojo, Lofty accidentally wrecks part of the sprung dance floor. Sylvain recognizes a kindred spirit in Lofty and urges him to follow his dreams, no matter how unlikely they may seem.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare follows some unusual tracks in the snow that eventually lead him to a shy little spotty deer. He plays with his new friend every day, until she has to leave again with her mother to search for food. Little Nutbrown Hare is sad to see her go, but he’s also glad that he has friends that stay in the meadow all year round.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The snow in the meadow is so deep that Little Nutbrown Hare has to stay under the Old Oak tree. Wondering what he is going to do all day in deep snow and with no one to play with, his imagination soon takes over as he creates new kinds of fun. By the time his friends reach him, Little Nutbrown Hare can’t believe how the time has flown!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a cold but sunny morning in the middle of Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare discovers his friends ice-skating on the frozen pond. He decides to give it a try but slips, slops and slides all over the ice. Will he persevere for long enough to be able to perfect his own unique style, or will he be put off by the natural skill of his friends?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: The class is having a picnic and everyone is happy. Especially Paxton! Learn about healthy snacks with Otus, Stripey and Yabba.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Huckle, Lowly and Sally find a lost bag, they use the eyeglass case, atomizer, map, and a red scarf inside it to determine that the owner is a famous international opera star who’s come to Busytown to perform for the first time./Cyclists getting flat tires somewhere in Busytown lead Huckle and the gang on a mystery.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, a poorly Messy is sitting in the living room feeling very sorry for himself. “Aaachooo!” he sneezes and he wipes his nose with a tissue. “Don’t like colds” he groans “but I love green socks” and guzzles down the nearest green sock he can find. Hmmm Messy looks confused and not satisfied at all. “Why does food taste different when I have a cold?” He transports himself to Okido to find out.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: In the real world, a single floating red balloon has caught Messy’s curiosity in the garden. Messy takes a gigantic leap into the air to catch the balloon as it floats past him but it’s no use! Other blue balloons bob on the ground but they don’t look as fun and floaty at all. “Aww”, says Messy, “I really wanted that red balloon! Why do some balloons float but others don’t?” He glances disappointedly at the red balloon as it continues to float further out of his reach. He transports himself to Okido to find out.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Day Of The Diesels Pe
programme.desc: The Steamies and the Diesels face off in this action-packed movie adventure! When a fire breaks out on the Island of Sodor, two new firefighting engines Flynn and Belle join Thomas and Percy to save the day!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: At the girls campout, Sour launches into a whopper of a yarn about the adventures she and Sweet had in the "Berry Deep Dark Forest." She tries to get Sweet to participate in spinning the tale, but Sours over-the-top performance leaves Sweet behind. Toward the end, Sour graciously changes the story to pull Sweet into it, giving Sweet the opportunity to toss in an ad lib that makes a nice topper to Sours story. Sweet is thrilled when everyone applauds her, even Sour, who is impressed by her contribution and proud of her sister.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: When Harry is disappointed that none of his wishes come true in the real world, the dinosaurs take him to visit the wishing well.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry, Charlie, and the dinosaurs are playing at being pirates.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers bring a young Rothschild’s giraffe to the savannah to find it a good home. However, the expedition comes to a standstill when the Junior Rangers’ jeep gets bogged in mud.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas misses his best friend Percy while working on the Chinese railway.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: A new tunnel-boring machine called Darcy arrives on Sodor. She has come to work on the new road being built by Miss Jenny’s Construction Crew and is eager to impress her new friends. She makes several mistakes, and worries she doesn’t fit in with the other engines. Nia encourages Darcy to be herself and she soon makes up for her mistakes when everyone sees what she can really do!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu is entrusted with what seems to be an easy mission. It consists in moving a beehive in a field of honey flowers. But things get complicated when an accident occurs, and the beehive gets lost. Moreover, Grisu has to deal with Fume who has a sore throat and cannot spit fire. Grisu will finally succeed in getting the bee queen (and the other bees) into the beehive thanks to Miss Gertruds perfume. And Fume will be cured thanks to the honey!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Natureza is on the ice cap conducting a polar bear study. She still has one last bear to tag but its too fast. So she needs a snowmobile pilot to help her approach and tag the beast. Its a perfect mission for Grisu who is no snowmobile pilot, but can adapt to anything and is impervious to cold! As he lands on the polar cap, Grisu unwittingly wakes up the napping bear and is chased after by it. He gets out of his bind thanks to Natureza. As theyre getting ready to tag the bear, Grisu, unwittingly again, burns the snowmobile engine. The mission seems compromised, but a firefighter never gives up! Resourceful Grisu uses his wind-filled parachute to pull the snowmobile and thanks to him, Natureza ends up tagging the bear.
